Hello
                In 45 minutes we will be having our FIRST drive day of the =
semester.
We will begin at 9:30 and go until 11 AM, when the Hackathon begins. Then a=
t 3:30 PM we will take a break from the Hackathon and drive for another hou=
r.

If you're not part of REVO, we cannot let you drive for liability reasons, =
but we would love for you to come out and support us! We will be driving in=
 Lot D.

The 4 Part Hackathon series CONTINUES! Feel free to stop on by and see what=
 we're up to.
                We will be meeting in AC304 from 11PM to 6PM.

Carpe Diem!

                James Nee


--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013548F51F7AEXVS01oline_

From Justin.Poh at students.olin.edu  Sat Feb  1 15:09:28 2014
From: Justin.Poh at students.olin.edu (Justin Poh)
Date: Sat, 1 Feb 2014 15:09:28 -0500
Subject: [Carpediem] FWOP is looking for keyboardists and light and sound
	designers!!
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013548F5209B@EXVS01.olin.edu>

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013548F5209BEXVS01oline_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hey Carpe!

tl;dr: If you want to play keyboard or design lights or sound for a broadwa=
y show, email me back! Keep reading for more info!

As you might have heard, FWOP is producing A Funny Thing Happened on the Wa=
y to the Forum for Candidate's Weekend. The show used to be on broadway man=
y years ago. We are still in need of the following people:


1.       3 keyboard players! You'll be playing either trombone, trumpet or =
percussion parts on a keyboard hooked up to a mac running mainstage! You'll=
 be with the rest of the instrumentalists in the pit! It'll be fun!

2.       Sound designer! 8 wireless lav packs, 10 channels of sound from th=
e pit. If you want to learn sound design for the theater or are interested =
in it, this is your chance! You don't need any experience. We'll teach you =
everything you need to know!

3.       Light Designer! The show doesn't require advanced lighting design =
but someone needs to make sure the roman set is well lit! Again, no experie=
nce necessary, we'll teach you everything you need to know!

Time commitments:


1.       Keyboard Players: Two 2hr rehearsals at the end of next week, 3 2h=
r rehearsals the following week and probably every night from the 17th to t=
he 20th (probably from 7pm to midnight). Shows are 21st, 22nd, 28th Februar=
y and 1st March

2.       Sound & Light Designers: Nothing until tech week (17th - 20th Febr=
uary) and then every night (probably from 6pm - midnight). Again, shows are=
 21st, 22nd, 28th February and 1st March


If you are interested in filling one of the above roles, please email me ba=
ck and we'll work stuff out.

Thanks!

Cheers,
Justin

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013548F5209BEXVS01oline_

From sebastian.dziallas at students.olin.edu  Sat Feb  1 15:35:28 2014
From: sebastian.dziallas at students.olin.edu (Sebastian Dziallas)
Date: Sat, 1 Feb 2014 15:35:28 -0500
Subject: [Carpediem] Baking/Cooking with Lynn!
In-Reply-To: <52DF24A5.40402@students.olin.edu>
References: <52DF24A5.40402@students.olin.edu>
Message-ID: <52ED5A90.3090405@students.olin.edu>

If you're interested in this, please fill out the following WhenIsGood 
here: http://whenisgood.net/5p9gewh

Lynn writes: "I will run this activity several (4-6?) times during the 
semester, likely with different projects each time.  What we do on any 
given evening will depend on the folks in the group for that date. 
Please sign up for what you'd be available for; I'll pick dates that 
work for me and for a critical mass of people, not more than 1/week. 
Group size for any given event is probably is 5-9 (plus me), so we have 
room in the kitchen.  Please add comments about what to make, scheduling 
info that's hard to put into whenisgood (e.g., not both of XX and YY, 
prefer ZZ, ...). We probably need 90m minimum for a session; 120 might 
be better.  Also, the 6pm start times are mostly after UOCD, so they'll 
be a 6pm+...."

--Sebastian

On 01/21/2014 08:53 PM, Sebastian Dziallas wrote:
> Would you be interested in a co-curricular-like experience of baking or
> cooking with Lynn? Let me know!
>
> --s
> _______________________________________________
> Carpediem mailing list
> Carpediem at lists.olin.edu
> https://lists.olin.edu/mailman/listinfo/carpediem
>

From Elliott.Donlon at students.olin.edu  Sat Feb  1 19:15:47 2014
From: Elliott.Donlon at students.olin.edu (Elliott Donlon)
Date: Sat, 1 Feb 2014 19:15:47 -0500
Subject: [Carpediem] The 3rd annual Star-Bowl-Craft!
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013548F52171@EXVS01.olin.edu>

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013548F52171EXVS01oline_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hello everyone, it is my pleasure to announce the premier super-bowl side e=
vent: THE STAR-BOWL-CRAFT occurring at 4:00 pm EST  tomorrow in EH1*!

Three years ago, a few gamers had a great idea to turn the super-bowl into =
more than just watching people play football on TV. We supplemented it with=
 a hearty helping of starcraft and fun with friends. Come and hang out and =
play whatever crazy gametypes we can think of just for giggles. We are like=
ly to also tune into the superbowl for those who are interested in watching=
 that too.

Thanks,
-Elliott

*Place subject to availability.

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013548F52171EXVS01oline_

Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

From: Elliott Donlon
Sent: Saturday, February 01, 2014 7:16 PM
To: 'carpediem at lists.olin.edu'
Subject: The 3rd annual Star-Bowl-Craft!

Hello everyone, it is my pleasure to announce the premier super-bowl side e=
vent: THE STAR-BOWL-CRAFT occurring at 4:00 pm EST  tomorrow in EH1*!

Three years ago, a few gamers had a great idea to turn the super-bowl into =
more than just watching people play football on TV. We supplemented it with=
 a hearty helping of starcraft and fun with friends. Come and hang out and =
play whatever crazy gametypes we can think of just for giggles. We are like=
ly to also tune into the superbowl for those who are interested in watching=
 that too.

Thanks,
-Elliott

*Place subject to availability.

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013548F5217CEXVS01oline_

 Magnificent Lemon Poppy Seed Protein Pancakes that also happen to be glute=
n free! We even have bacon, real maple syrup, and greek yogurt to go with t=
hem! I have no idea how many this recipe will make, so I apologize ahead of=
 time if they run out. Come for food and for friends. It's a good way to st=
art Sunday mornings.

on Poppy Seed Protein Pancakes that also happen to be gluten free! We even =
have bacon, <i>real</i> maple syrup, and greek yogurt to go with them! I ha=
ve no idea how many this recipe will make, so I apologize ahead of time if =
they run out. Come for food and for friends. It&#8217;s a good way to start=
 Sunday mornings.<o:p></o:p></p><p class=3DMsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><=
p class=3DMsoNormal>-the Breakfast Club<o:p></o:p></p></div></body></html>=

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013548F521E0EXVS01oline_--

From: Elliott Donlon
Sent: Saturday, February 01, 2014 7:16 PM
To: 'carpediem at lists.olin.edu'
Subject: The 3rd annual Star-Bowl-Craft!

Hello everyone, it is my pleasure to announce the premier super-bowl side e=
vent: THE STAR-BOWL-CRAFT occurring at 4:00 pm EST  tomorrow in EH1*!

Three years ago, a few gamers had a great idea to turn the super-bowl into =
more than just watching people play football on TV. We supplemented it with=
 a hearty helping of starcraft and fun with friends. Come and hang out and =
play whatever crazy gametypes we can think of just for giggles. We are like=
ly to also tune into the superbowl for those who are interested in watching=
 that too.

Thanks,
-Elliott

*Place subject to availability.

From Slater.Victoroff at students.olin.edu  Sun Feb  2 18:53:15 2014
From: Slater.Victoroff at students.olin.edu (Slater Victoroff)
Date: Sun, 2 Feb 2014 18:53:15 -0500
Subject: [Carpediem] Startup Fair Resumes
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013546FE1334@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hey all!

Just another reminder that the startup fair is coming up (Feburary 19th from approx. 12:00 - 1:30).

If you haven't submitted your resume yet, we'd still love to have it! Worth noting that we are also still doing resume feedback if you want some help getting your resume in top shape. If you are looking for resume feedback rather than submitting your resume for inclusion in the company booklet, just say so.

Reminders for formats: Submit a pdf and call it something descriptive (Not resume.pdf)

Slater on behalf of the Foundry

Want to teach kids about science?
Like Cambridge? Or science fairs?

Consider submitting a project to the Cambridge Science Festival<http://www.=
cambridgesciencefestival.org/Home.aspx>! It's an awesome fair in April that=
 would be awesome to go to and even better to showcase something at!

Let me know if you have any questions.

-Aditi (and CORe)

It's a HTR-5440. It's missing the remote, and although I don't know if the =
it provides you with additional capabilities, is not necessary for adjustin=
g bass/treble, input, and a variety of other things, which you can do just =
fine with its buttons. As far as I've been able to tell using it for a year=
 it is in perfect working order. It goes online for between $70 - $110 used=
 (with shipping) or $200 new, so how's $50 sound? Come by for a listen if y=
ou're interested in how it sounds.

Info:
http://usa.yamaha.com/products/audio-visual/av-receivers-amps/htr/htr-5440_=
black__u/?mode=3Dmodel

What it goes for online:
http://www.ebay.com/itm/Yamaha-HTR-5440-Channel-210-Watt-Receiver-/22135340=
6409?pt=3DUS_Stereo_Receivers&hash=3Ditem3389b0efc9                        =
     (~$110, used)
http://www.ebay.com/itm/like/281228378015?lpid=3D82                   (~$70=
, used)
http://www.overstock.com/Electronics/Yamaha-HTR-5440-AV-Receiver/1006008/pr=
oduct.html               (~$200, new)

Let me know!

From: carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu [mailto:carpediem-bounces at lists.olin=
.edu] On Behalf Of Michael Resnick
Sent: Sunday, February 2, 2014 8:12 PM
To: carpediem at lists.olin.edu
Subject: [Carpediem] Selling Yamaha receiver

It's a HTR-5440. It's missing the remote, and although I don't know if the =
it provides you with additional capabilities, is not necessary for adjustin=
g bass/treble, input, and a variety of other things, which you can do just =
fine with its buttons. As far as I've been able to tell using it for a year=
 it is in perfect working order. It goes online for between $70 - $110 used=
 (with shipping) or $200 new, so how's $50 sound? Come by for a listen if y=
ou're interested in how it sounds.

Info:
http://usa.yamaha.com/products/audio-visual/av-receivers-amps/htr/htr-5440_=
black__u/?mode=3Dmodel

What it goes for online:
http://www.ebay.com/itm/Yamaha-HTR-5440-Channel-210-Watt-Receiver-/22135340=
6409?pt=3DUS_Stereo_Receivers&hash=3Ditem3389b0efc9                        =
     (~$110, used)
http://www.ebay.com/itm/like/281228378015?lpid=3D82                   (~$70=
, used)
http://www.overstock.com/Electronics/Yamaha-HTR-5440-AV-Receiver/1006008/pr=
oduct.html               (~$200, new)

Let me know!

a:link, span.MsoHyperlink
	{mso-style-priority:99;
	color:blue;
	text-decoration:underline;}
a:visited, span.MsoHyperlinkFollowed
	{mso-style-priority:99;
	color:purple;
	text-decoration:underline;}
span.EmailStyle17
	{mso-style-type:personal-compose;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";
	color:windowtext;}
.MsoChpDefault
	{mso-style-type:export-only;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";}
@page WordSection1
	{size:8.5in 11.0in;
	margin:1.0in 1.0in 1.0in 1.0in;}
div.WordSection1
	{page:WordSection1;}
--></style><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>

F.I.L.M. Club Presents: The Master<http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3DfJ1O1vb=
9AUU>
10:00 pm Today, Auditorium

[cid:image002.jpg at 01CF21A5.0270EFB0]

The Master is a 2012 film written and directed by Paul Thomas Anderson. The=
 film gained some controversy when comparisons between an organization in t=
he film and the church of Scientology were made. The film stars Joaquin Pho=
enix (recent star of Her) and the late Philip Seymour Hoffman.

John Arakaki, F.I.L.M. Director
Amanda Lee, 143 Minute Run Time
Shivam Desai, Pot Stickers

o   Amazon Info Session, 6:15 pm, AC 126 Pizza and Prizes! RSVP to Suzanne<=

=A7  Amazon is hiring for both full time & internships (more details below)

=A7  Check out what it is like to work at Amazon and watch this 2-minute vi=
deo:  Click Here<http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3DSpXMWRiR3iE&sns=3Dem>


Amazon - Seattle, WA
Software Development Engineer Intern
We hire software development engineer interns into our technical teams base=
d in Seattle, Washington. Our interns and co-ops write real software and pa=
rtner with a select group of experienced software development engineers, wh=
o both help and challenge them as they work on projects that matter to our =
customers. Impact: As a member of the Amazon development team, you'll be gi=
ven the opportunity to have direct impact on the evolution of the Amazon e-=
commerce platform and lead mission critical projects early in your career. =
Your design, code and raw smarts will contribute to solving some of the mos=
t complex technical challenges in the areas of distributed systems, data mi=
ning, optimization, scalability, security and tweaking algorithms, just to =
name a few. More....<http://www.amazon.com/gp/jobs/ref=3Dj_sq_btn?jobSearch=
Keywords=3D237396>
Amazon - Seattle, WA
Software Development Engineer
Do you want to own cutting edge technology, solve new problems that didn't =
exist before, and have the ability to see the impact of your successes? Ama=
zon is growing, and we need SDEs/SDETs who move fast, are capable of breaki=
ng down and solving complex problems, and have a strong will to get things =
done. SDEs/SDETs at Amazon work on real world problems on a global scale, o=
wn their systems end to end and influence the direction of our technology t=
hat impacts hundreds of millions customers around the world. More...<http:/=
/www.amazon.com/gp/jobs/122383>

Suzanne Alcott
Corporate Relations Coordinator
781-292-2282 (p)

From Ankeet.Mutha at students.olin.edu  Tue Feb  4 16:07:54 2014
From: Ankeet.Mutha at students.olin.edu (Ankeet Mutha)
Date: Tue, 4 Feb 2014 16:07:54 -0500
Subject: [Carpediem] Caveperson Week and Money
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40135491F2DDD@EXVS01.olin.edu>

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40135491F2DDDEXVS01oline_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hello all Cavepeople,

Ignore this if you did not participate in Caveperson week. Also ignore this=
 if you did not pay for caveperson week. If you have paid for caveperson we=
ek and succeeded, please fill out this spreadsheet(https://docs.google.com/=
spreadsheet/ccc?key=3D0Aro8vXqUxQTXdGNoeHRFcHp4WldPdUZNQnRHUmt4dWc&usp=3Dsh=
aring) so I can give you back your money plus a little extra from those who=
 failed. If you failed caveperson week, also fill out the spreadsheet so th=
at I can figure out how much money to pay.

Thanks,
A failed caveperson

From: carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu [mailto:carpediem-bounces at lists.olin=
.edu] On Behalf Of Ankeet Mutha
Sent: Sunday, January 26, 2014 12:32 PM
To: carpediem at lists.olin.edu
Subject: [Carpediem] Caveperson Week

tl;dr: We are having a competition to not use any eating utensils for a wee=
k.

Let loose your inner caveman this week. How you ask? Sign up on this google=
 doc (https://docs.google.com/spreadsheet/ccc?key=3D0Aro8vXqUxQTXdGNoeHRFcH=
p4WldPdUZNQnRHUmt4dWc&usp=3Dsharing), Pay or venmo me $5, Eat without utens=
ils until before brunch next Sunday. Everyone who succeeds gets to split th=
e pot.
Rules:

1.       You cannot use any utensils (fork, knives, chopsticks, etc.) to pu=
t food into your mouth

2.       You can serve food onto your plate using utensils.

3.       You can use dishes (plates, bowls, mugs, etc.) to hold your food

4.       Any food item should not touch more than one dish. (This prevents =
people from using dishes as utensils)

5.       If you are using food as a utensil, you must at least plan on eati=
ng it.

Email me with any queries. I hope you have a happy caveperson week.



Ankeet




--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40135491F2DDDEXVS01oline_

p:12.0pt'>Rules:<span style=3D'color:#1F497D'> </span><o:p></o:p></p><p cla=
ss=3DMsoListParagraphCxSpFirst style=3D'margin-top:12.0pt;mso-add-space:aut=
o;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span st=
yle=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>1.<span style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbs=
p;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span><![endif]>You cannot use any=
 utensils (fork, knives, chopsticks, etc.) to put food into your mouth<o:p>=
</o:p></p><p class=3DMsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style=3D'margin-top:12.0pt;=

ou can serve food onto your plate using utensils.<o:p></o:p></p><p class=3D=

xt-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span style=

lates, bowls, mugs, etc.) to hold your food<o:p></o:p></p><p class=3DMsoLis=
tParagraphCxSpMiddle style=3D'margin-top:12.0pt;mso-add-space:auto;text-ind=
ent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span style=3D'mso=
-list:Ignore'>4.<span style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&n=
bsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span><![endif]>Any food item should not tou=
ch more than one dish. (This prevents people from using dishes as utensils)=
<o:p></o:p></p><p class=3DMsoListParagraphCxSpLast style=3D'margin-top:12.0=
pt;mso-add-space:auto;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo2'><![if !su=
pportLists]><span style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>5.<span style=3D'font:7.0pt "Ti=
mes New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span><![endif=
]>If you are using food as a utensil, you must at least plan on eating it.<=

Amazon - Seattle, WA
Software Development Engineer Intern
We hire software development engineer interns into our technical teams base=
d in Seattle, Washington. Our interns and co-ops write real software and pa=
rtner with a select group of experienced software development engineers, wh=
o both help and challenge them as they work on projects that matter to our =
customers. Impact: As a member of the Amazon development team, you'll be gi=
ven the opportunity to have direct impact on the evolution of the Amazon e-=
commerce platform and lead mission critical projects early in your career. =
Your design, code and raw smarts will contribute to solving some of the mos=
t complex technical challenges in the areas of distributed systems, data mi=
ning, optimization, scalability, security and tweaking algorithms, just to =
name a few. More....<http://www.amazon.com/gp/jobs/ref=3Dj_sq_btn?jobSearch=
Keywords=3D237396>
Amazon - Seattle, WA
Software Development Engineer
Do you want to own cutting edge technology, solve new problems that didn't =
exist before, and have the ability to see the impact of your successes? Ama=
zon is growing, and we need SDEs/SDETs who move fast, are capable of breaki=
ng down and solving complex problems, and have a strong will to get things =
done. SDEs/SDETs at Amazon work on real world problems on a global scale, o=
wn their systems end to end and influence the direction of our technology t=
hat impacts hundreds of millions customers around the world. More...<http:/=
/www.amazon.com/gp/jobs/122383>

interns and full time hires!!
Presentation on Amazon culture and Software Development starts at 6:15!

From: carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu<mailto:carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.=
edu> [mailto:carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu] On Behalf Of Suzanne Alcott
Sent: Tuesday, February 04, 2014 3:24 PM
To: carpediem at lists.olin.edu<mailto:carpediem at lists.olin.edu>
Subject: [Carpediem] Amazon Info Session Tonight!


o   Amazon Info Session, 6:15 pm, AC 126 Pizza and Prizes! RSVP to Suzanne<=
mailto:suzanne.alcott at olin.edu>

=A7  Amazon is hiring for both full time & internships (more details below)

=A7  Check out what it is like to work at Amazon and watch this 2-minute vi=
deo:  Click Here<http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3DSpXMWRiR3iE&sns=3Dem>


Amazon - Seattle, WA
Software Development Engineer Intern
We hire software development engineer interns into our technical teams base=
d in Seattle, Washington. Our interns and co-ops write real software and pa=
rtner with a select group of experienced software development engineers, wh=
o both help and challenge them as they work on projects that matter to our =
customers. Impact: As a member of the Amazon development team, you'll be gi=
ven the opportunity to have direct impact on the evolution of the Amazon e-=
commerce platform and lead mission critical projects early in your career. =
Your design, code and raw smarts will contribute to solving some of the mos=
t complex technical challenges in the areas of distributed systems, data mi=
ning, optimization, scalability, security and tweaking algorithms, just to =
name a few. More....<http://www.amazon.com/gp/jobs/ref=3Dj_sq_btn?jobSearch=
Keywords=3D237396>
Amazon - Seattle, WA
Software Development Engineer
Do you want to own cutting edge technology, solve new problems that didn't =
exist before, and have the ability to see the impact of your successes? Ama=
zon is growing, and we need SDEs/SDETs who move fast, are capable of breaki=
ng down and solving complex problems, and have a strong will to get things =
done. SDEs/SDETs at Amazon work on real world problems on a global scale, o=
wn their systems end to end and influence the direction of our technology t=
hat impacts hundreds of millions customers around the world. More...<http:/=
/www.amazon.com/gp/jobs/122383>

Suzanne Alcott
Corporate Relations Coordinator
781-292-2282 (p)

Reminder that you have to move your car out of B by 10 PM tonight!
I just moved mine and there were still a bunch of cars there.
~Liz

From: Russell Zacharias
Sent: Tuesday, February 04, 2014 10:52 AM
To: Olin Listserve; Students - All Olin Students; Public Safety
Subject: Snow Event Parking Notification - 10:00 PM Tuesday Feb 4th

Good Afternoon,

In preparation for the winter storm approaching early Wednesday, Feb 5th, w=
e are requesting that we implement Snow Emergency parking to assist with th=
e snow removal efforts.   All motor vehicles must be moved to Lot A (rows 4=
, 5 and 6) or Lot C by 10:00 PM, Tuesday, Feb 4th.  We are asking for Membe=
rs of the community who are leaving a vehicle on campus, to park in these d=
esignated Snow Emergency parking areas (Lot A, rows 4, 5 and 6 or Lot C).
Student parking in Lot A (rows 1, 2 or 3); Lot B-2, or Lot D is prohibited =
after 10:00 PM, Tuesday, Feb 4th and throughout the storm.   Students are t=
o park in the designated Snow Emergency parking areas (Lot A, rows 4, 5 and=
 6 or Lot C).
Thank you for your cooperation, your help with this matter is appreciated a=
nd is a tremendous help to Facilities' during our snow removal efforts.



Russ Zacharias

Director of Facilities
Olin College of Engineering
781-292-2317

[cid:image001.png at 01CF2196.AB1C66D0]


--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40135491F2F05EXVS01oline_

From ariana.chae at students.olin.edu  Wed Feb  5 13:18:00 2014
From: ariana.chae at students.olin.edu (Ariana Chae)
Date: Wed, 5 Feb 2014 13:18:00 -0500
Subject: [Carpediem] CW Friday Night Activities
Message-ID: <CAHT-TTCAGnUOz-65R_KzvXVaukjBtErRFTPxPQr-YJ3nHZEYag@mail.gmail.com>

--089e0149ce3c14dd0a04f1acc81a
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1

short:

Run fun activities with candidates on Friday evenings!

long:

In the past, we've featured different activities on Friday evenings. My
year, we had a selection of activities we could do: playing with
ink/pipettes in the bio lab, making food catapults, etc.

Do you have an idea for a fun activity candidates could do for an hour and
a half? Let me know and we may be able to make it happen!

If not enough people are interested, we're going to make the candidates sit
for another hour and a half listening to the faculty q&a with their
parents. (Which, no offense, would really suck compared to the fun things
we can show them.)

-Ari

--089e0149ce3c14dd0a04f1acc81a
Content-Type: text/html; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hi, all -
I know how busy everyone is and I really wouldn't ask unless it was pressin=
g. We need a couple of extra volunteers to help us QA the new olin.edu so t=
hat we can stay on schedule and launch the week of 2/17.

We're essentially testing links, videos, images, just making sure everythin=
g is rendering well and links are working, etc. We'll send you a list of ab=
out 20 URL's to check and provide feedback on, it's taken most of our volun=
teers about 1-2 hours but we do need it done as soon as possible =96 like b=
y Monday morning :)

Please let me know if you're willing and able.

Thanks!
-Alyson

Hey everyone!

Just a reminder that the startup fair is happening in less than 2 weeks! It's on February 19th, from noon to approximately 1:30.

If you haven't already, make sure you send your resume to startupfair2014 at gmail.com as a PDF with a descriptive filename (not resume.pdf) to be included in the booklet.

Thanks!

From Franz.Schneider at students.olin.edu  Fri Feb  7 13:10:22 2014
From: Franz.Schneider at students.olin.edu (Franz Schneider)
Date: Fri, 7 Feb 2014 13:10:22 -0500
Subject: [Carpediem] [Help You] Control your print life!
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013549462B39@EXVS01.olin.edu>

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013549462B39EXVS01oline_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Tl;dr - change your print preferences to automatically secure print and sta=
ple your files. Save time, pain, and paper. Profit.


Have you ever printed things and then realized that you didn't want to prin=
t them right after it's too late? It's super easy to set the defaults for a=
ll of your printers so that your files automatically Secure Print and autom=
atically staple the output papers, and if you're unfamiliar with these opti=
ons you should try them, they're magical.


*         Control Panel -> Hardware and Sound -> Devices and Printers

*         Right click -> Printing Preferences

o   Change 'Job Type' to 'Secure Print' and choose a password you'll rememb=
er

o   I change 'Finishing' to '1 Staple' because then you never have to look =
for a stapler

o   I change the 'Print Quality' to 'Toner Saver', choose yours as you like

o   If you want a printer to consistently print in color, I think going int=
o 'Image Options' and unchecking 'Xerox Black and White Conversion' should =
do it for you. If the option isn't there, I believe that means the printer =
can't do color.

*         Hit apply

*         Do this for all of your printers, 5 minutes tops.

Do it! A lot of paper is wasted at Olin by people who print things on accid=
ent, you can see it piled on top of every printer around. Take a minute and=
 you can print things without stress, because the secure print job can be c=
anceled at the printer. Secure print jobs also never go missing, because yo=
u print them and pick them up at the same time.

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013549462B39EXVS01oline_

reak? Is there just not enough a cappella in your life in general?<o:p></o:=
p></p><p class=3DMsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=3DMsoNormal><span =
style=3D'font-size:12.0pt'>Meet PowerChords at </span><b><span style=3D'fon=
t-size:14.0pt'>5:45pm tonight</span></b><span style=3D'font-size:14.0pt'> <=
b>in</b> <b>AC 128 </b>and come<b> watch our dress rehearsal!!<o:p></o:p></=
b></span></p><p class=3DMsoNormal><b><span style=3D'font-size:12.0pt'><o:p>=
&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></p><p class=3DMsoNormal>We would really appreciate =
practicing for an audience before ICCA tomorrow.<o:p></o:p></p><p class=3DM=

Shane

Begin forwarded message:

From: Shane Skikne <Shane.Skikne at students.olin.edu<mailto:Shane.Skikne at stud=
ents.olin.edu>>
Date: February 6, 2014 at 10:01:43 PM EST
To: "studentevents at lists.olin.edu<mailto:studentevents at lists.olin.edu>" <st=
udentevents at lists.olin.edu<mailto:studentevents at lists.olin.edu>>
Subject: [StudentEvents] Shabbat Dinner!

Hello Friends!

JOO (Jewish Organization at Olin) would like to invite you to join us this =
Friday evening for a Shabbat evening AT OLIN! We will have a short service =
and then a homecooked Shabbat dinner that will be held in collaboration wit=
h Wellesley Hillel.

Services will begin at 6pm and dinner will follow at 6:30 in the Crescent r=
oom. We would love to have any member of the Olin community join us for ser=
vices, dinner, or both!

Hope to see you there!
Rebecca, Shane, Alison and Jamie on behalf of JOO


--_000_BB6C7172C4C8413D9EC18F4B074367F7studentsolinedu_

From Murphy.Kitchell at students.olin.edu  Sat Feb  8 13:38:03 2014
From: Murphy.Kitchell at students.olin.edu (Murphy Kitchell)
Date: Sat, 8 Feb 2014 13:38:03 -0500
Subject: [Carpediem] Help me get us working vacuum cleaners!
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40135496A38EF@EXVS01.olin.edu>

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40135496A38EFEXVS01oline_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

We're trying to clean our hallway right now, and so far every single vacuum=
 cleaner in east hall has been broken, all with snapped drive belts. It's b=
asically a big rubber band, so it should be super easy to replace, we just =
don't have any. I've emailed workorders to ask them to stock them in the ut=
ility closets, but the more they hear students asking for it, the more like=
ly they are to do something promptly.

So if you've ever found one of the olin vacuum cleaners broken (or found th=
ree in a row broken), please let facilities know that you want drive belts =
available. Because sweeping a carpet sucks.

Thanks,
                -Murphy

From Ian.Hill at students.olin.edu  Sat Feb  8 23:38:25 2014
From: Ian.Hill at students.olin.edu (Ian Hill)
Date: Sat, 8 Feb 2014 23:38:25 -0500
Subject: [Carpediem] Only at Olin
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40135496A3AD0@EXVS01.olin.edu>

--_005_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40135496A3AD0EXVS01oline_
Content-Type: multipart/alternative;
	boundary="_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40135496A3AD0EXVS01oline_"

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40135496A3AD0EXVS01oline_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hi all!
Tl;dr - I'm looking for a team of Oliners who would like to help inform oth=
er students about what's happening on campus!

Despite having only about 350 students, it seems that we know very little a=
bout what's happening in other clubs, research labs, and in the college adm=
inistration. I would like to change that with Only at Olin. Now, it would b=
y no means replace Frankly Speaking, but Only at Olin would be a slide show=
 presented in the Dining Hall designed by Oliners, for Oliners with the goa=
l of making students aware of practical and exciting information. The launc=
h date is still TBD, but I would like it to be published on a weekly basis.=
 Slides could convey information regarding:

*         Student events

*         CORe, SAC, and SAC

*         Interesting club activities

*         Personal student projects

*         Faculty projects and research

*         Administrative happenings

*         Course information

*         Other information that students might not come across in their da=
ily routines
The commitment can be as small or as large as you like; the goal here would=
 not be to publish long articles, but rather to convey snippets of insightf=
ul information accompanied by eye-catching pictures.

If you are at all interested, please let me know.
All the best,

Ian Hill
Class of 2017

[cid:image002.png at 01CF2526.DBFA1B60]

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40135496A3AD0EXVS01oline_

Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

nowman died of unfortunate (yet hilarious) humping. Thank our inebriated ne=
ighbors to the West who promptly hauled ass after falling off the no longer=
 alive snowman.

Apologies for the music and vertical video syndrome.

Hi guys!

As you may have heard, PowerChords had an awesome time at ICCA last night. =
Especially cool was the Best Arrangement award, which Kyle arranged and Ing=
rid sang. Ask the people who went - we've heard it was a fun performance.

 directing work :)

Subject: [Carpediem] Free Stuff at Harbor Freight

Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

If you want some cheap goods free, here's a link to six coupons for free th=
ings (can only use one at a time).

http://images.harborfreight.com/hftweb/home-page2014/images020414a/free-cou=
pons0214.pdf

Items you can get:

*         Led light

*         5'x6' tarp

*         Power strip

*         6 screwdriver set

*         Tape measure

*         Magnetic bowl to hold parts

For those of you who don't know there's a harbor freight out in Natick, nea=
r the Home Depot.

From Jeffrey.Holzgrafe at students.olin.edu  Sun Feb  9 13:38:41 2014
From: Jeffrey.Holzgrafe at students.olin.edu (Jeffrey Holzgrafe)
Date: Sun, 9 Feb 2014 13:38:41 -0500
Subject: [Carpediem] Volunteer with Science Olympiad!
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40135496A3C27@EXVS01.olin.edu>

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40135496A3C27EXVS01oline_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

The Massachusetts State Science Olympiad Tournament is on March 22 (2nd Sat=
urday of spring break), and they need more volunteers to help run events fo=
r the high-school competitors. You'd be helping out an event organizer who'=
s planned everything already and just needs people to enforce rules and run=
 the event. It's a lot of fun to hang out with the other volunteers (mostly=
 university students and engineers from around the Boston area) and help th=
e kids out.

Olin's sent ~10 people for the past two years, let's do it again!

Sign up here<https://docs.google.com/spreadsheet/ccc?key=3D0Au5A2JUbtjewdFJ=
UNTg5WGZTTlJyMTk4Y0RLQ3hSM0E&usp=3Dsharing>! (I'll close signup in about a =
week, so don't procrastinate!)

Details: The tournament allows high school teams to compete in a number of =
science and engineering related events. It's in Framingham on 3/22 from 8am=
 to 2pm. Lunch is provided. We'll arrange rides. You get some flexibility i=
n choosing events you're interested in.

Feel free to ask me any questions,
Jeff


--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40135496A3C27EXVS01oline_

><p class=3DMsoNormal>Details: The tournament allows high school teams to c=
ompete in a number of science and engineering related events. It&#8217;s in=
 Framingham on 3/22 from 8am to 2pm. Lunch is provided. We&#8217;ll arrange=
 rides. You get some flexibility in choosing events you&#8217;re interested=
 in. <o:p></o:p></p><p class=3DMsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=3DMs=
oNormal>Feel free to ask me any questions,<o:p></o:p></p><p class=3DMsoNorm=
al>Jeff<o:p></o:p></p><p class=3DMsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p></div></bod=
y></html>=

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40135496A3C27EXVS01oline_--

From Philip.Seger at students.olin.edu  Sun Feb  9 14:10:35 2014
From: Philip.Seger at students.olin.edu (Philip Seger)
Date: Sun, 9 Feb 2014 14:10:35 -0500
Subject: [Carpediem] The Babson Snowman face off of 2014

It was a fight that should never have been seen. However, the valiant Nagy =
helped foster the Snowman's legacy, and illustrate the Babson way of taking=
 down snowmen. Head over to P:\Death of a Snowman\Love Making.avi<file:///\=
\fsvs01\Public\Death%20of%20a%20Snowman\Love%20Making.avi> and P:\Death of =
a Snowman\Wrecking Babos.avi<file:///\\fsvs01\Public\Death%20of%20a%20Snowm=
an\Wrecking%20Babos.avi> to find the artistic renditions of what happened l=
ast night.

Philip

From Mitchell.Cieminski at students.olin.edu  Sun Feb  9 15:15:06 2014
From: Mitchell.Cieminski at students.olin.edu (Mitchell Cieminski)
Date: Sun, 9 Feb 2014 15:15:06 -0500
Subject: [Carpediem] The Babson Snowman face off of 2014
In-Reply-To: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40135496A3C69@EXVS01.olin.edu>
References: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40135496A3C69@EXVS01.olin.edu>
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013546FEF1D0@EXVS01.olin.edu>

I would like to point out to everybody that somebody (nobody knows who) gave the snowman an artistic touch shortly before his untimely demise. As seen in  P:\Death of a Snowman\snowwalker.jpg , the snowman was recently given arms and butcher-paper underpants, making him into a snowy pastiche of the sleepwalker sculpture at our neighbor, Wellesley College. We mourn his loss.

________________________________________
From: carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu [carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu] On Behalf Of Philip Seger
Sent: Sunday, February 09, 2014 2:10 PM
To: carpediem at lists.olin.edu
Subject: [Carpediem] The Babson Snowman face off of 2014

It was a fight that should never have been seen. However, the valiant Nagy helped foster the Snowman?s legacy, and illustrate the Babson way of taking down snowmen. Head over to P:\Death of a Snowman\Love Making.avi<file:///\\fsvs01\Public\Death%20of%20a%20Snowman\Love%20Making.avi> and P:\Death of a Snowman\Wrecking Babos.avi<file:///\\fsvs01\Public\Death%20of%20a%20Snowman\Wrecking%20Babos.avi> to find the artistic renditions of what happened last night.

Philip

From Colby.Sato at students.olin.edu  Sun Feb  9 17:22:21 2014
From: Colby.Sato at students.olin.edu (Colby Sato)
Date: Sun, 9 Feb 2014 17:22:21 -0500
Subject: [Carpediem] Canvas Stretching and Painting
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013547F277EF@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hello,

Art club has purchased the supplies to make six canvasses. We have canvas cloth, canvas frames (aka. Stretchers) and gesso. We also have some nice oil paints and oil medium. 
If you'd like a free lesson on stretching a canvas and/or painting, contact me, and I'll organize a group work session. This may happen during Saturday arts time, or another time. We'll see what works best. 

The commitment would be maybe an hour and half for stretching and gesso, then painting some time a week later. 

Message me by the end of the week if you're interested. 
Colby

Thank you,
~Nick Lapin

-----Original Message-----
From: David Pudlo [David.Pudlo at students.olin.edu]
Received: Sunday, 09 Feb 2014, 12:04PM
To: carpediem at lists.olin.edu [carpediem at lists.olin.edu]
Subject: [Carpediem] Free Stuff at Harbor Freight

If you want some cheap goods free, here=92s a link to six coupons for free =
things (can only use one at a time).

http://images.harborfreight.com/hftweb/home-page2014/images020414a/free-cou=
pons0214.pdf

Items you can get:

=B7         Led light

=B7         5=92x6=92 tarp

=B7         Power strip

=B7         6 screwdriver set

=B7         Tape measure

=B7         Magnetic bowl to hold parts

For those of you who don=92t know there=92s a harbor freight out in Natick,=
 near the Home Depot.

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401354705472FEXVS01oline_

-----Original Message-----
From: David Pudlo [David.Pudlo at students.olin.edu]
Received: Sunday, 09 Feb 2014, 12:04PM
To: carpediem at lists.olin.edu<mailto:carpediem at lists.olin.edu> [carpediem at li=
sts.olin.edu]
Subject: [Carpediem] Free Stuff at Harbor Freight
If you want some cheap goods free, here's a link to six coupons for free th=
ings (can only use one at a time).

http://images.harborfreight.com/hftweb/home-page2014/images020414a/free-cou=
pons0214.pdf

Items you can get:

*         Led light

*         5'x6' tarp

*         Power strip

*         6 screwdriver set

*         Tape measure

*         Magnetic bowl to hold parts

For those of you who don't know there's a harbor freight out in Natick, nea=
r the Home Depot.

From William.Saulnier at students.olin.edu  Sun Feb  9 20:04:35 2014
From: William.Saulnier at students.olin.edu (William Saulnier)
Date: Sun, 9 Feb 2014 20:04:35 -0500
Subject: [Carpediem] Dominos Pizza Order: Return of the King Edition
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40135475137AD@EXVS01.olin.edu>

tl;dr pizza order 9 dollars for any medium 2 topping pizza please order within the hour

So, perhaps your a hobbit, and you missed elevensees. Or perhaps you're a wise old wizard who speaks in riddles and craves the occasional treat. Or your a dwarf, hardy and strong, looking to fill your belly with food and song. Well, you don't have to travel to the fiery pits of Mordor to enjoy bread with toppings. Just 9 gold pieces from Smaug's hoard and you'll be able to enjoy the finest cuisine in middle earth!

Email me your order within the hour, or lest a terrible fate befall you...

-W

I have offered my room (in WH1N) to be open for all three weekends. Problem=
 is, it's completely boring! (Seriously, I could carpe a "decorate my room"=
 as a SAC study break and it would be legit). Help me come up with ideas, d=
ecorate, have a dance party, put up a theme, pretend to be my roommate, bur=
y yourself in my puzzle stash and paper pile and pretend like candies do no=
t exist, etc.

Only rule don't break or take my stuff (or me for that matter) and keep it =
G rated.

-------- Original Message --------
Subject: 	Re: [Helpme] Babysitters at Candidates' Weekend 1

From: 	Emily Moscol <Emily.Moscol at olin.edu>

Another call for babysitters, so far we have only one person for this
weekend and we need two more. The pay just went up to $10/hr.

Let me know!

*From:*Emily Moscol
*Sent:* Monday, February 10, 2014 2:56 PM
*To:* 'helpme at lists.olin.edu'
*Subject:* Babysitters at Candidates' Weekend 1

Hi all!
We are looking for three *experienced *babysitters to work at CW1 (THIS
SATURDAY) from 12 noon until 6 pm on campus. We have 7-8 kids coming,
ages 1-10.

We will pay you the student worker rate. They will have their own toys,
etc. but will need to be fed snacks. We will have them in the Crescent Room.

Let me know if you?re interested!  We will likely need other folks for
CW2 and 3 as well, so if you?re free those Saturdays at the same time,
let me know.

Thanks,

Emily

From Brian.Liebson at students.olin.edu  Tue Feb 11 22:15:35 2014
From: Brian.Liebson at students.olin.edu (Brian Liebson)
Date: Tue, 11 Feb 2014 22:15:35 -0500
Subject: [Carpediem] New Club: Fit Club!
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401354990114D@EXVS01.olin.edu>

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401354990114DEXVS01oline_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Howdy y'all!

So I'm starting a new club, Fit Club. The goal behind Fit Club is to promot=
e a healthy and active lifestyle at Olin and beyond! (mostly just at Olin).

We have a mailing list here:
https://lists.olin.edu/mailman/listinfo/fitclub



Whether you go to the gym 7 days a week, want to start going to the gym, do=
 yoga, play a sport, or are just totally completely inactive, you should jo=
in the mailing list.

Why?

Because there are three main components of Fit Club that will benefit you:

The Discussion - The mailing list is openly available to talk about differe=
nt supplements, gym habits, general fitness events nearby, and much more.
It is a safe environment to ask stupid questions; we encourage a friendly d=
iscussion between anyone from regular gym goers to someone who's never touc=
hed a weight.
It's also an easy place to find a gym buddy, ask about busy hours, or discu=
ss gym schedules.

The Competition - This is where it gets fun. Every semester, Fit Club will =
hold a semester-long transformation competition.
Whether your goal is to lose weight, build muscle, or completely change you=
r body, the Fit Club Transformation Challenge will keep you motivated to co=
mpletely renew your body.
At the beginning of the semester, you take two relaxed photos of yourself a=
nd send it to the list. At the end of the semester, you do the same thing, =
and we can compare how we've all changed.
Everyone on the list will vote for which man and which woman had the best t=
ransformations.
The winners will each receive a bro tank saying something along the lines o=
f "Fittest Nerd" and "Mr/s. Olin Spring 2014" or something silly like that.

Optionally Being Held Accountable - A significant part about being fit is d=
iscipline, something that does not come easy. As most people who work out k=
now, it's hard to stay motivated sometimes.
Fit Club, as well as being a place for motivation, will also be a place to =
be held accountable. If someone wants, they can choose to donate money to t=
he club with a fitness goal (go to gym x times a week for xx weeks).
If that person fulfills their goal, they can take their money back. However=
, if they do not succeed, they can still have their money back (much agains=
t the spirit of "being held accountable"), but are encouraged to let it be =
a donation.
The point of this is that people can "pay" the club to hold them accountabl=
e to work out. In this way, both the person working out wins because they b=
ecome more fit while the club wins because we either help someone get fit, =
or get donations that will go to further competitions to purchase protein b=
ars or other fun prizes. Once again, this is completely optional.


Any questions? Comments? Concerns? Please let me know. Also join the mailin=
g list @ https://lists.olin.edu/mailman/listinfo/fitclub.

Competition is starting next weekend!



Brian Liebson

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401354990114DEXVS01oline_

Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

TL;DR FWOP meeting during Thursday lunch in the crescent room. Everyone wel=
come! Big changes to be discussed!

Hey all!

FWOP is having a meeting open to all current/past/future FWOP members (or j=
ust interested Oliners) to discuss the future of our club. We're envisionin=
g some big changes on the horizon and need your opinions! If you're at all =
interested please stop by for as little or as much of the meeting as you ca=
n make. We're meeting this Thursday, February 13, 2014 in the crescent room=
. Come if you want to have a say in the future of this organization!

                Thanks all!
                -Chelsea

PS: Some things to think about before the meeting: Are you interested in a =
leadership role (president, production manager, or technical manager)? What=
 type of theater or roles in theater (on or off stage) do you enjoy most?

Ooga Booga, Ooga Booga!

This weekend, Man Hall is taking all of us back to 10,000 BC for the Stone
Rage. We need some Sabertooth Cat Tamers to help the tribespeople of
Wellesley to join us. We will compensate drivers as follows:

1st shift, 10pm-12am, $10/hr + $5/hr for gas
2nd shift, 1am-3am, $15/hr + $5/hr for gas

That's good money! Let me know if interested.

From Jessica.Townsend at olin.edu  Tue Feb 11 12:44:22 2014
From: Jessica.Townsend at olin.edu (Jessica Townsend)
Date: Tue, 11 Feb 2014 12:44:22 -0500
Subject: [Carpediem] Hacking Medicine Event March14-16
In-Reply-To: <CAEN0pK_4bCnAx2Nwst5XSUWHptnwKt4OHnk6tpoMKbw0T4y5Ng@mail.gmail.com>
References: <CAEN0pK_4bCnAx2Nwst5XSUWHptnwKt4OHnk6tpoMKbw0T4y5Ng@mail.gmail.com>
Message-ID: <CF1FCAC7.5D83F%jessica.townsend@olin.edu>

--_000_CF1FCAC75D83Fjessicatownsendolinedu_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="Windows-1252"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hi All,

I wanted to share a pretty cool opportunity with all of you (and feel free =
to forward to other lists).

A few Olin students participated in the last Hacking Medicine event and tho=
ught it was great. This is an even bigger event and is taking place March 1=
4 =96 16 (just as spring break starts) so it should work well for people th=
at are interested. A link and some more info is below.

Details can be found here: http://hackingmedicine.mit.edu/2014/02/03/hc-gra=
nd-hackfest/

Jessica


The Kauffman Foundation in collaboration with H at cking Medicine will be kick=
ing off THE Hackathon of all hackathons come this March 14-16 at MIT=92s Me=
dia Lab. Entrepreneurs, designers, engineers, and healthcare professionals =
alike will apply and be selected to be part of this event, in which creativ=
e solutions and innovative breakthroughs will be designed and prototyped ov=
er the course of a weekend.

Focused on pioneering healthcare=92s greatest innovations, this hackathon w=
ill be unlike any other in the past. For the first time ever, we will be pa=
rtnering with industry=92s leading organizations to accelerate breakthrough=
 ideas developed over the course of the weekend into sustainable solutions =
to be piloted following the hackathon. With varied tracks (e.g. diabetes, p=
ayors, sensors, telehealth, resource-constrained), a host of the healthcare=
=92s toughest pain points in certain selective areas will be better underst=
ood, analyzed, and reinvented. By joining together diverse minds alike in t=
heir interest for solving healthcare=92s biggest challenges, the root of th=
ese problems will be diagnosed from multiple different perspectives and thu=
s be able to be revolutionized.

More specifically, participants will choose a track Friday during an introd=
uctory mixer while meeting fellow teammates so as to dedicate all available=
 hacking time Saturday and Sunday to identifying and working on a pain poin=
t for a particular area of concern in healthcare. During hacking time, team=
s will meet with relevant mentors within their track, who will give them va=
luable feedback and advice.

Sunday evening will conclude with a grand finale for each respective track,=
 wherein teams will present the problem they choose to hack, their idea/pro=
totype, and progress over the course of the weekend. A panel of judges spec=
ific to each track will evaluate teams and the winners of each track will b=
e announced in the final closing ceremony to follow. Teams will then leave =
the weekend inspired, encouraged, and equipped with resources necessary to =
continue developing their solutions further.

From: Allison Yost <allison.l.yost at gmail.com<mailto:allison.l.yost at gmail.co=
m>>
Date: Friday, February 7, 2014 at 4:20 PM
To: Jessica Townsend <jessica.townsend at olin.edu<mailto:jessica.townsend at oli=
n.edu>>
Subject: Hacking Medicine Event March14-16

Hi Jessica,
Happy New Year! I hope all is well with you, and everything is going great =
at Olin!

I wanted to reach out to you and let you know that we are planning our bigg=
est healthcare hackathon event to date March 14-16 at MIT's campus.

Details can be found here: http://hackingmedicine.mit.edu/2014/02/03/hc-gra=
nd-hackfest/

We'd love to have a bunch of Olin students attend!

Best wishes,
Ally

--_000_CF1FCAC75D83Fjessicatownsendolinedu_

MassChallenge is an amazing program if you're looking to start a company or=
 already doing a startup. They're very friendly to early stage companies, a=
nd they love to see engineers starting companies. There are tons of free bo=
nuses that come with being a finalist, like free space which includes a nic=
e little hardware space, including free access to a FormLabs 3D printer.

If you're interested in applying, feel free to talk to me. I'm happy to giv=
e feedback on applications. As an MC alum, I think I also get a code to get=
 you a discount on the application fee.

Good luck!
-Amos

February 12, 2014



We're Launched! 2014 Applications are Now Open!



>From its new home in the Innovation and Design Building, MassChallenge offi=
cially opened applications for the 2014 startup accelerator<http://r20.rs6.=
net/tn.jsp?e=3D001L5tJDVIguRpbhFSAHHPz0OtvN0n15qixL9Z8auiIRibJVwB9fHf4-NYTV=

Zr1oiITu5HiEGZ4FROchfycM1j4jdAi6t6NqGNhEDlTxNueHZiccRAW0GeU1Ff83yzJj57jU5E3=
1_IYkN> today.



Entrepreneurs can apply to MassChallenge<http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=3D001L=
5tJDVIguRpCLKRU0AF6CU4p0xWSFeCcXRJjZzvSZbM3oKcAAlaqCeRVpkqRQUiUzwv5CN7HV38r=

km9InYAa9E-20pCmRi6LqptglksyKHnljVaxpLfAxHMVQ3o4WOSQ=3D=3D> by March 5 for =
Early Bird registration!



Governor Deval Patrick, one of MassChallenge's earliest supporters, and new=
ly elected Boston Mayor Marty Walsh both spoke at the launch event, noting =
the leadership roles of MassChallenge and Boston in global, innovation-driv=
en economic development.

Hey Olin!

REVO is having design reviews this week.

Electrical systems: Thursday Feb. 13 from 12:45pm to 1:15pm
Mechanical systems: Friday Feb. 14 from 12:45pm to 1:15pm

We'd love <3  if you could join us to see what REVO has been up to over the=
 last couple of weeks and give us some critical feedback. Seriously, we wan=
t to hear your opinions on and suggestions for our designs.

Also feel free to bring your lunch.

Thanks!
Luke


p.s. Credit for subtle valentines joke goes to James Nee ;)

o:p></p><p class=3DMsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=3DMsoNormal>REVO=
 is having design reviews this week.<o:p></o:p></p><p class=3DMsoNormal><o:=
p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=3DMsoNormal>Electrical systems: <b>Thursday Feb.=
 13 from 12:45pm to 1:15pm</b><o:p></o:p></p><p class=3DMsoNormal>Mechanica=
l systems: <b>Friday Feb. 14 from 12:45pm to 1:15pm</b><o:p></o:p></p><p cl=
ass=3DMsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=3DMsoNormal>We&#8217;d <b><sp=
an style=3D'font-size:26.0pt;color:red'>love &lt;3 </span></b>&nbsp;if you =
could join us to see what REVO has been up to over the last couple of weeks=
 and give us some critical feedback. Seriously, we want to hear your opinio=
ns on and suggestions for our designs.<o:p></o:p></p><p class=3DMsoNormal><=
o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=3DMsoNormal>Also feel free to bring your lunch=

mal>Thanks!<o:p></o:p></p><p class=3DMsoNormal>Luke<o:p></o:p></p><p class=

From Christopher.Mark at students.olin.edu  Wed Feb 12 21:51:18 2014
From: Christopher.Mark at students.olin.edu (Christopher Mark)
Date: Wed, 12 Feb 2014 21:51:18 -0500
Subject: [Carpediem] Environmental Health & Biotech event at Wellesley 3/8
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013549901710@EXVS01.olin.edu>

--_004_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013549901710EXVS01oline_
Content-Type: multipart/alternative;
	boundary="_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013549901710EXVS01oline_"

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013549901710EXVS01oline_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable


To: Christopher Mark;
Subject: Spreading this at Olin!

Hi, guys!

I'm organizing a large annual event called Communicating Science (happening=
 Saturday, March 8th from 10:30-3 pm), which is all about communicating com=
plexity around environmental health and biotechnology to the public and pol=
icy makers.

We're really trying to get more people from off campus to attend and I thin=
k a lot of people at Olin would be interested, especially since we have an =
afternoon poster fair/ networking session for students to show their resear=
ch/ design ideas on a broad range of topics relating to health and biotechn=
ology. I'm attaching the Save-the-Date and the concept note below  - can yo=
u have this put in your school's newsletter? Here's the link to our website=
 where you can register<https://sites.google.com/site/wellesleycommsci/>. I=
 hope you'll be able to come and bring  your friends. If anyone expresses i=
nterest in volunteering for the event, please let me know!

If you have names of any students or faculty who would might want to submit=
 their posters to have on display during the poster session, let me know!

Thanks for your support with this :)



Concept Note, "Communicating Science 2014: Environmental Health and Biotech=
nology"


We live in a society where science is central to policy decisions around co=
mplex issues and is therefore often politicized. For example, policy discus=
sion around climate change mirrors a large disconnect between scientific co=
nsensus and public perception; while there is a 97% consensus among climate=
 scientists that anthropogenic climate change is a reality, only 47% of Ame=
ricans believe in the science. There are also a sharp partisan divide over =
the issue, which is influenced by political and economic stakeholders who w=
ant the science on their side. While climate change is a well-known example=
 of the need for more effective science communication, there are many other=
 important issues where this is the case: genetic modification, the effects=
 of prenatal drugs, and environmental toxins. This has profound effects on =
the well-being and sustainability of our society and environment.


To understand the depth of the problem our society faces in communicating s=
cience and to discuss potential solutions for systemic change, the annual W=
ellesley Communicating Science Symposium brings together scientists, journa=
lists, and activists for a day of dialogue and problem-solving. Since 2010,=
 our Communicating Science symposia have brought together several hundred p=
eople from Wellesley, surrounding universities, and the Boston community to=
 discuss the complexities around communicating science to policy makers and=
 the public. Previous keynote speakers have included Elizabeth Grossman, Ja=
mes Hansen, and Matthew Nisbet. Panelists have included Environmental Healt=
h Services journalist Wendy Hessler, Wellesley College President Kim Bottom=
ly, and many others.

The 2014 Communicating Science Symposium seeks to address issues relating t=
o communicating environmental health and biotechnology research to the publ=
ic and policy makers. Terms like "genetically modified organism" have becom=
e taboo, as many people associate these modern technologies as harmful to t=
he environment and risks to human health. The symposium will address challe=
nges to communicating the science behind these complex issues to the public=
 and policy makers. Professor Rita Colwell, a renowned environmental microb=
iologist at the University of Maryland at College Park, former president of=
 the American Association for the Advancement of Science, and long-time dir=
ector of the National Science Foundation, will be our keynote on the subjec=
t. Following her address, a panel featuring speakers from the biotech indus=
try, journalists, and environmental health advocates will further the dialo=
gue on communicating the science of biotechnology. An afternoon networking =
session showcasing student research from schools in the Boston area will ex=
tend the day's conversation to practical applications, giving students agen=
cy and direction in their own scientific pursuits. The symposium will provi=
de a useful forum for the pursuit of solutions to communicating science and=
 the education of students and the general public.

[cid:image001.jpg at 01CF2839.3A284BC0]




--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013549901710EXVS01oline_

 important issues where this is the case: genetic modification, the effects=
 of prenatal drugs, and environmental toxins. This has profound effects on =
the well-being and sustainability of our society and environment.</span><sp=
an style=3D'font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Georgia","serif"'><o:p></o:p></sp=
an></p><p class=3DMsoNormal><span style=3D'font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Ge=
orgia","serif"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p><p style=3D'margin:0in;margin-b=
ottom:.0001pt'><span style=3D'font-size:11.5pt'>To understand the depth of =
the problem our society faces in communicating science and to discuss poten=
tial solutions for systemic change, the annual Wellesley Communicating Scie=
nce Symposium brings together scientists, journalists, and activists for a =
day of dialogue and problem-solving. <span style=3D'color:#1A1A1A'>Since 20=
10, our Communicating Science symposia have brought together several hundre=
d people from Wellesley, surrounding universities, and the Boston community=
 to discuss the complexities around communicating science to policy makers =
and the public. Previous keynote speakers have included Elizabeth Grossman,=
 James Hansen, and Matthew Nisbet. Panelists have included Environmental He=
alth Services journalist Wendy Hessler, Wellesley College President Kim Bot=
tomly, and many others.</span></span><span style=3D'font-size:10.0pt;font-f=
amily:"Georgia","serif"'><o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=3DMsoNormal><span s=
tyle=3D'font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Georgia","serif"'><br></span><span st=
yle=3D'font-size:11.5pt;color:#1A1A1A'>The 2014 Communicating Science Sympo=
sium seeks to address issues relating to <u>communicating environmental hea=
lth and biotechnology</u> research to the public and policy makers. Terms l=
ike &#8220;genetically modified organism&#8221; have become taboo, as many =
people associate these modern technologies as harmful to the environment an=
d risks to human health. The symposium will address challenges to communica=
ting the science behind these complex issues to the public and policy maker=
s. Professor Rita Colwell, a renowned environmental microbiologist at the U=
niversity of Maryland at College Park, former president of the American Ass=
ociation for the Advancement of Science, and long-time director of the Nati=
onal Science Foundation, will be our keynote on the subject. Following her =
address, a panel featuring speakers from the biotech industry, journalists,=
 and environmental health advocates will further the dialogue on communicat=
ing the science of biotechnology. An afternoon networking session showcasin=
g student research from schools in the Boston area will extend the day&#821=
7;s conversation to practical applications, giving students agency and dire=
ction in their own scientific pursuits. The symposium will provide a useful=
 forum for the pursuit of solutions to communicating science and the educat=
ion of students and the general public.</span><span style=3D'font-size:10.0=
pt;font-family:"Georgia","serif"'><o:p></o:p></span></p></div><div><p class=
=3DMsoNormal><span style=3D'font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Georgia","serif"'=
><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p></div><div><p class=3DMsoNormal><span style=3D=
'font-size:11.5pt;color:#1A1A1A'><img border=3D0 width=3D428 height=3D553 i=
d=3D"_x0000_i1025" src=3D"cid:image001.jpg at 01CF2839.3A284BC0" alt=3D"Inline=
 image 1"></span><span style=3D'font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Georgia","ser=
if"'><o:p></o:p></span></p></div></div></div></div><div><div><p class=3DMso=
Normal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p></div><div><p class=3DMsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:=
p></p></div><div><p class=3DMsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p></div></div></di=
v></div></body></html>=

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013549901710EXVS01oline_--

From Kimly.Do at students.olin.edu  Thu Feb 13 09:09:10 2014
From: Kimly.Do at students.olin.edu (Kimly Do)
Date: Thu, 13 Feb 2014 09:09:10 -0500
Subject: [Carpediem] James Regulinski ('12) Talks about Real World
 Sustainable and Affordable Design
In-Reply-To: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013547696135@EXVS01.olin.edu>
References: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40135499015AB@EXVS01.olin.edu>
	<DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013547696135@EXVS01.olin.edu>
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40135969C0533@EXVS01.olin.edu>

--_004_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40135969C0533EXVS01oline_
Content-Type: multipart/alternative;
	boundary="_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40135969C0533EXVS01oline_"

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40135969C0533EXVS01oline_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Thursday, Feb 20th
8:00pm, EH1 Lounge

Join James Regulinski, '12 as he shares his experiences working for All Pow=
er Labs<http://allpowerlabs.org/>, a company making an affordable biomass g=
enerator that provides sustainable energy all over the world.

We'll have some of James's favorite locally-sourced cheese and environmenta=
lly responsible noms. James is a very thoughtful and values-driven person, =
and he has taken bold steps to situate himself where he can make the most o=
f his experiences. James has a very clear perspective on life that he'd lik=
e to share with current Oliners!

A message from James:
Hi everyone, I graduated Olin in December of 2012 and was looking for a pla=
ce to work that could use the prototyping, mechanical, fabrication, and des=
ign skills I had acquired at Olin, and focused on either sustainable design=
 or engineering for the other 4 billion. That is when I found All Power Lab=
s (APL).

APL makes a integrated gasifier-generator unit, that fits in the foot print=
 of a standard shipping pallet. Much like Mr. Fusion from Back To The Futur=
e, our machine takes waste biomass and turns it into electricity. The techn=
ology is currently being used to provide power to under electrified areas i=
n Liberia, Indonesia, Haiti (along with many other areas) as well as clean =
power to the grid in Italy and the USA.

During this session I will talk about how the core technology works, how af=
fordability and sustainability have drive the product design, and how I am =
using what I learned at Olin to help make this all happen.

-.- -.- -.... -.. ..-. --.
James Marshall
 Myers Regulinski

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40135969C0533EXVS01oline_

v></body></html>=

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40135969C0533EXVS01oline_--

From Jeffrey.Holzgrafe at students.olin.edu  Thu Feb 13 11:59:34 2014
From: Jeffrey.Holzgrafe at students.olin.edu (Jeffrey Holzgrafe)
Date: Thu, 13 Feb 2014 11:59:34 -0500
Subject: [Carpediem] Volunteer with Science Olympiad!
In-Reply-To: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40135496A3C27@EXVS01.olin.edu>
References: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40135496A3C27@EXVS01.olin.edu>

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40135969C05EEEXVS01oline_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

FYI I'm closing this tonight. Sign up now or forever hold your peace!

From: carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu [mailto:carpediem-bounces at lists.olin=
.edu] On Behalf Of Jeffrey Holzgrafe
Sent: Sunday, February 09, 2014 1:39 PM
To: carpediem at lists.olin.edu
Subject: [Carpediem] Volunteer with Science Olympiad!

The Massachusetts State Science Olympiad Tournament is on March 22 (2nd Sat=
urday of spring break), and they need more volunteers to help run events fo=
r the high-school competitors. You'd be helping out an event organizer who'=
s planned everything already and just needs people to enforce rules and run=
 the event. It's a lot of fun to hang out with the other volunteers (mostly=
 university students and engineers from around the Boston area) and help th=
e kids out.

Olin's sent ~10 people for the past two years, let's do it again!

Sign up here<https://docs.google.com/spreadsheet/ccc?key=3D0Au5A2JUbtjewdFJ=
UNTg5WGZTTlJyMTk4Y0RLQ3hSM0E&usp=3Dsharing>! (I'll close signup in about a =
week, so don't procrastinate!)

Details: The tournament allows high school teams to compete in a number of =
science and engineering related events. It's in Framingham on 3/22 from 8am=
 to 2pm. Lunch is provided. We'll arrange rides. You get some flexibility i=
n choosing events you're interested in.

Feel free to ask me any questions,
Jeff


--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40135969C05EEEXVS01oline_

From: carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu [mailto:carpediem-bounces at lists.olin=
.edu] On Behalf Of Luke Morris
Sent: Wednesday, February 12, 2014 7:52 PM
To: carpediem at lists.olin.edu
Subject: [Carpediem] REVO

Hey Olin!

REVO is having design reviews this week.

Electrical systems: Thursday Feb. 13 from 12:45pm to 1:15pm
Mechanical systems: Friday Feb. 14 from 12:45pm to 1:15pm

We'd love <3  if you could join us to see what REVO has been up to over the=
 last couple of weeks and give us some critical feedback. Seriously, we wan=
t to hear your opinions on and suggestions for our designs.

Also feel free to bring your lunch.

Thanks!
Luke


p.s. Credit for subtle valentines joke goes to James Nee ;)

From Juliana.Nazare at students.olin.edu  Thu Feb 13 13:48:29 2014
From: Juliana.Nazare at students.olin.edu (=?UTF-8?Q?Juliana_Nazar=C3=A9?=)
Date: Thu, 13 Feb 2014 13:48:29 -0500
Subject: [Carpediem] Event on immigration law and working for startups
Message-ID: <CAM5S6_6cbC9=PeajU55c1HCewwL63HjOgwd3aO0ZQQNx-_2mtg@mail.gmail.com>

--089e0149cdb2d71e0d04f24e2381
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="UTF-8"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

=E2=80=8BIf you are interested in immigration law and how it relates to sta=
rtups...
http://www.meetup.com/rdvsketch/events/165554092/
=E2=80=8B=E2=80=8B

=E2=80=8BMore info below:=E2=80=8B


Join us for the next #RDVSketch. We'll be gathering on Monday, February
24th to discuss the state of immigration in the world of startups. Whether
you're founding a startup as an immigrant or are just interested in the
state of legislation regarding innovation and immigration, come by and join
the conversation!

Rough Draft Sketch is a monthly meetup, sponsored by Rough Draft Ventures,
which pulls together university students from around the Boston area to
discuss the pains and pleasures of starting and running technology
startups. Each #RDVSketch features a panel of thought leaders,
entrepreneurs, and innovators from around the world, all interested in
helping tomorrow's leaders soak up the knowledge needed to succeed in
founding new, world-changing ventures.

Free food and drinks are included at every #RDVSketch, so be sure to save
that campus cash and come satisfy your tummy and your brain, all at once!

This installment on immigration and startups is brought to you by Rough
Draft Ventures and FWD.us. Learn more below!

About Our Speakers

[image: Jeff Goldman]

Jeff Goldman has practiced exclusively in the area of business immigration
law for the past 21 years, concentrating on technology and life science
start-ups. As a mentor to MIT, Harvard, TechStars and Mass Challenge
start-ups, Jeff has helped entrepreneurial founders and investors
understand and implement effective immigration strategies. He is a past
recipient of the "Pro Bono Attorney of the Year" award from the Political
Asylum/Immigrant Representation Project in Boston, due to his extensive
work with refugees. Jeff has the highest rating offered by
Martindale.com=E2=80=94=E2=80=9CAV Preeminent 5.0 out of 5=E2=80=9D and has=
 been named by Boston
Magazine as a =E2=80=9CSuperLawyer=E2=80=9D for ten consecutive years. Jeff=
 has guided more
than 500 start-up companies to obtain H-1B, L-1, O-1, J-1, TN, E-1, E-2,
and E-3 visas. "Immigration policy in the US for start-ups and
entrepreneurs is far too conservative and restrictive," he says. "We should
have a policy that gives equal energy to security and to innovation/job
creation. Every entrepreneur with a valid business plan and backing from a
US company should get an 18 month work visa to give them an opportunity to
create a business and jobs here in the US."

James Richards is the co-founder and CEO of
Teleborder<https://teleborder.com/>,
a venture-backed startup based in San Francisco. Teleborder manages global
immigration for companies that are hiring foreign talent or sending
employees on international assignments, and their investors include Khosla
Ventures, Y Combinator, and leading angels. Before Teleborder, James was a
corporate lawyer at Davis Polk & Wardwell in New York. James was born in
Adelaide, Australia and grew up in Jakarta, Indonesia. He is the youngest
ever graduate of Columbia Law School and passed the New York Bar Exam at
age 20. He received an LL.B. with First Class Honors from King's College
London and a J.D. from Columbia Law School, where he was a Harlan Fiske
Stone Scholar and Editor-in-Chief of the Columbia Journal of European Law.
"Innovation is an output of people, and immigration is the way we get
talented people working together in the same place," James says. "In terms
of specific policies, I'd like to see a greater emphasis placed on
effecting change through executive action - simplifying administrative
rules, decision-making, and paperwork for visa applications - over purely
legislative/Congressional measures."

[image: Paige Brown]

Paige Brown is a serial entrepreneur with a love for the travel industry.
Prior to Dashbell <http://www.dashbell.com/>, she co-founded BookingMarkets
and founded Tripeezy, a social travel planning website with which she was
one of the first participants in the Start-Up Chile program. She has
traveled to 49 countries and speaks 3 languages. Paige has an MBA from
Vanderbilt University and studied marketing at Southern Methodist
University. As co-founder and CEO of Dashbell, Brown is based out of
Boston, while much of her team is while all of Dashbell's international
employees work full-time out of the startup's Bogot=C3=A1 office or in othe=
r
locations. Brown's team, as a result, has been able to sidestep immigration
issues by founding a non-US hub. "Immigration should promote and encourage
entrepreneurs from all over the world to stay and work in the US," she
says. "I think its a shame how many friends of mine are working in global
startups that are unable to stay in the US and continue to work in the
eco-system. We will gain far more from these entrepreneurs allowing them to
stay full time in the US."

[image: Andrew Mallon]

Dr. Andrew Mallon founded Calista
Therapeutics<http://calistatherapeutics.com/> in
2012 based upon the discovery and development of a technology platform of
novel peptide and protein therapeutics that modulate the cellular
transport, location and activation of membrane receptors, including the
defective Cystic Fibrosis chloride channel. He is a serial biotech
entrepreneur with 15 years experience, specializing in the identification
and creation of early stage value in promising therapeutics in diseases
that have high unmet clinical need. Previously, Dr. Mallon founded Ardane
Therapeutics, Inc. (USA), and Carlton Pharmaceutics (UK). Dr Mallon is an
inventor on 5 patents based upon his discoveries in addition to several
publications. He has a Ph.D. in Medicine from the University of Glasgow,
undertook research and taught at Brown University Medical School and is a
registered pharmacist. A Scottish immigrant himself, Dr. Mallon believes
that "the massive and wasteful immigration system [in the states] has
provided the USA with the sort of self-perpetuating bureaucracy that
undermines our growing innovation economy and replaces it with a government
economy of red tape." He adds, "Broadly, the future immigration system
should serve to facilitate the economy by reflecting accurately and
responsively to the changing demands of the economy rather than the current
system that dictates to the economy how it can grow."

--089e0149cdb2d71e0d04f24e2381

e as a =E2=80=9CSuperLawyer=E2=80=9D for ten consecutive years. Jeff has=C2=
=A0guided more than 500 start-up companies to obtain H-1B, L-1, O-1, J-1, T=
N, E-1, E-2, and E-3 visas. &quot;Immigration policy in the US for start-up=
s and entrepreneurs is far too conservative and restrictive,&quot; he says.=
 &quot;We should have a policy that gives equal energy to security and to i=
nnovation/job creation. Every entrepreneur with a valid business plan and b=
acking from a US company should get an 18 month work visa to give them an o=
pportunity to create a business and jobs here in the US.&quot;</p>

<p style=3D"margin:0px 0px 18px;padding:0px;color:rgba(0,0,0,0.670588);font=
-family:Whitney,helvetica,arial,sans-serif;font-size:15.555556297302246px;l=
ine-height:24.88888931274414px"><img src=3D"https://evbdn.eventbrite.com/s3=
-s3/eventlogos/2602747/jamesrichards.jpg" width=3D"200" height=3D"200" styl=
e=3D"margin: 10px; padding: 0px; border: 0px; line-height: 0; max-width: 70=
0px; display: block; max-height: 700px; float: right;"></p>

<p style=3D"margin:0px 0px 18px;padding:0px;color:rgba(0,0,0,0.670588);font=
-family:Whitney,helvetica,arial,sans-serif;font-size:15.555556297302246px;l=
ine-height:24.88888931274414px"><span style=3D"font-weight:700">James Richa=
rds</span>=C2=A0is the co-founder and CEO of=C2=A0<a href=3D"https://telebo=
rder.com/" style=3D"display:inline;color:rgb(42,155,199);text-decoration:no=
ne">Teleborder</a>, a venture-backed startup based in San Francisco. Telebo=
rder manages global immigration for companies that are hiring foreign talen=
t or sending employees on international assignments, and their investors in=
clude Khosla Ventures, Y Combinator, and leading angels. Before Teleborder,=
 James was a corporate lawyer at Davis Polk &amp; Wardwell in New York. Jam=
es was born in Adelaide, Australia and grew up in Jakarta, Indonesia. He is=
 the youngest ever graduate of Columbia Law School and passed the New York =
Bar Exam at age 20. He received an LL.B. with First Class Honors from King&=
#39;s College London and a J.D. from Columbia Law School, where he was a Ha=
rlan Fiske Stone Scholar and Editor-in-Chief of the Columbia Journal of Eur=
opean Law. &quot;Innovation is an output of people, and immigration is the =
way we get talented people working together in the same place,&quot; James =
says. &quot;In terms of specific policies, I&#39;d like to see a greater em=
phasis placed on effecting change through executive action - simplifying ad=
ministrative rules, decision-making, and paperwork for visa applications - =
over purely legislative/Congressional measures.&quot;</p>

<p style=3D"margin:0px 0px 18px;padding:0px;color:rgba(0,0,0,0.670588);font=

 0; max-width: 700px; display: block; max-height: 700px; float: right;"></p=
>

<p style=3D"margin:0px 0px 18px;padding:0px;color:rgba(0,0,0,0.670588);font=

ine-height:24.88888931274414px"><span style=3D"font-weight:700">Paige Brown=
</span>=C2=A0is a serial entrepreneur with a love for the travel industry. =

color:rgb(42,155,199);text-decoration:none">Dashbell</a>, she co-founded Bo=
okingMarkets and founded Tripeezy, a social travel planning website with wh=
ich she was one of the first participants in the Start-Up Chile program. Sh=
e has traveled to 49 countries and speaks 3 languages. Paige has an MBA fro=
m Vanderbilt University and studied marketing at Southern Methodist Univers=
ity. As co-founder and CEO of Dashbell, Brown is based out of Boston, while=
 much of her team is=C2=A0while all of Dashbell&#39;s international employe=
es work full-time out of the startup&#39;s=C2=A0Bogot=C3=A1=C2=A0office or =
in other locations. Brown&#39;s team, as a result, has been able to sideste=
p immigration issues by founding a non-US hub.=C2=A0&quot;Immigration shoul=
d promote and encourage entrepreneurs from all over the world to stay and w=
ork in the US,&quot; she says. &quot;I think its a shame how many friends o=
f mine are working in global startups that are unable to stay in the US and=
 continue to work in the eco-system. We will gain far more from these entre=
preneurs allowing them to stay full time in the US.&quot;</p>

<p style=3D"margin:0px 0px 18px;padding:0px;color:rgba(0,0,0,0.670588);font=

<p style=3D"margin:0px 0px 18px;padding:0px;color:rgba(0,0,0,0.670588);font=

s that have high unmet clinical need. Previously, Dr. Mallon founded Ardane=
 Therapeutics, Inc. (USA), and Carlton Pharmaceutics (UK). Dr Mallon is an =
