lications. He has a Ph.D. in Medicine from the University of Glasgow, under=
took research and taught at Brown University Medical School and is a regist=
ered pharmacist. A Scottish immigrant himself, Dr. Mallon believes that &qu=
ot;the massive and wasteful immigration system [in the states] has provided=

 growing innovation economy and replaces it with a government economy of re=
d tape.&quot; He adds, &quot;Broadly, the future immigration system should =
serve to facilitate the economy by reflecting accurately and responsively t=
o the changing demands of the economy rather than the current system that d=
ictates to the economy how it can grow.&quot;</p>

semester at Babson. We are looking for people who would like to help out wi=
th Tech for the show. All the information is below. If you are interested, =
you can email me or email Kevin directly.

From: Babson Players [mailto:babsonplayers at gmail.com]

ord... Huh.

It includes everything and anything that doesn't involve getting on stage f=
or Chicago. Whether you want to learn how to operate the lighting board, or=
 brush up on your sweeping skills, this may just be the resume builder you'=
ve been looking for.

Set build dates are April 5 & 6, tech week goes on all week April 7-12), an=
d show nights are April 10-12 (with set deconstruction after the show). We =
have plenty to do, including sourcing costumes, between now and then so any=
 help would be appreciated.

Please email me<mailto:kliu5 at babson.edu> if you're interested in helping ou=
t or know somebody who is.

Cheers,

Subject: [Carpediem] Shuttle Drivers Needed

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40135969C0803EXVS01oline_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hello peeps,

This Saturday Man Hall is throwing our next party of the semester and we'd =
love your help in getting some friends from off campus here, aka we need sh=
uttle drivers.

The details are as follows:
Two shifts: 10PM - 12AM and 1AM - 3AM.
Pay: $10/hr as well as $5/hr if you use your own car.
We'll also let a friend of your's in for FREE.

Let me know if you're interested,

Mark Giolando

From: Ian Hill
Sent: Wednesday, February 12, 2014 6:29 PM
To: Jiaying Wei; Elizabeth Doyle; Cullen Ross; Lindsey Vanderlyn; Susan Gri=
mshaw; Ariana Chae; Riley Chapman; Graham E. Hooton; Mika Ichiki-Welches; A=
nders Johnson; Charlie at moutons.org; Ian Hill; Joshua Sapers; Alison Wu; Hen=
ry Horsey; Beverly Walker; Haley Pelletier; Eleanor Funkhouser; Megan McCau=
ley; Halley Pollock-Muskin; Chelsea Nayback; Jessica Diller; Dennis Chen; D=
imitar Dimitrov; Ryan Louie; Jennifer Wei; Sarah Walters; Lindsey Andrade; =
Alexander Crease; Anne LoVerso; Kaitlin Gallagher; Liani Lye
Subject: CW 1 Volunteers
Importance: High

Hi all!
Setting up for the Design Challenge will occur at 9:30 PM on Friday in AC 2=
13. Many hands make for light work, so if everyone could help out, it shoul=
dn't take too long.

Sorry to get you all up early on a Saturday morning, but we have a lot to d=
o to prepare for the candidates.
There will be a required briefing on Saturday morning at 8:45 sharp in AC 2=
13. Please do not be late! We need time to answer any and all questions you=
 might have about the design challenge. If you did not get a chance to read=
 the schedule Charlie sent out, the Design Challenge starts at 9:30AM.

Attached you will find a description of this year's challenge which you sho=
uld all read carefully. You will also find a description of roles as well a=
s the iCals associated with the set up and briefing mentioned above.

If you have not signed up for a particular role for this weekend, please ad=
d your name to this spreadsheet!
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheet/ccc?key=3D0AmMCXLbN5RlOdEo2SXVlUWx6SnFC=
NExLVWVCU3FqcHc&usp=3Dsharing#gid=3D1

Let's have fun!!! See you on Friday!
-Ian, Liani, and Graham

	text-decoration:underline;}

Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013596F19E3E@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hey All!

Just a reminder to everyone that the Startup Fair is happening next Wednesday (February 19th).

Last call for resumes to be included in the information sent out to companies.

Send resumes to startupfair2014 at gmail.com

1. Send as a PDF
2. Name the file something reasonable (NameInCamelCase.pdf is great)

Let us know if you have any more questions.

Slater on behalf of the Foundry

P.S. We've got two more companies coming not included in the packet: Ovuline and Avatech

didates!

ll at 5:20 to help hand out fliers to the candidates to tell them about it!

Subject: [Carpediem] Startup Fair Happening Tomorrow!
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013596F19E44@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hey Everybody!

Just sending out a reminder to everyone that the startup fair is in fact happening tomorrow! The times are nominally from 12:00 - 1:30, but startups will show up a little early and stay a little late, so feel free to do the same.

We'll be putting some more packets around the tables come dinner time with a couple of last minute adjustments.

As always, feel free to email if you have any questions.

Slater on behalf of the Foundry.

P.S. Last minute changes:

Additional companies that will be in attendance:
MassChallenge
High Tech Ventures
Ovuline
Avatech

ProductionPro will NOT be attending. They cancelled at the last minute.

F.I.L.M. Club Presents: Fruitvale Station<http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3D=
ceVVVils8z4>
10:00 pm Today, Auditorium

[cid:image002.jpg at 01CF2CAF.65FEA580]

Fruitvale Station is a 2013 drama written by first time director Ryan Coogl=
er. The film won the Grand Jury Prize at Sundance 2013 and best first film =
at Cannes 2013. The film stars Michael B. Jordan who is set to play Johnny =
Storm in the upcoming Fantastic Four reboot.

John Arakaki, F.I.L.M. Director
Amanda Lee, 85 Minute Run Time
Helen Lyons, Bagel Bites

From Stephanie.Northway at students.olin.edu  Tue Feb 18 14:56:32 2014
From: Stephanie.Northway at students.olin.edu (Stephanie Northway)
Date: Tue, 18 Feb 2014 14:56:32 -0500
Subject: [Carpediem] (no subject)
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401359721B47A@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hey all,

As I'm sure you're aware, the Startup Fair is happening tomorrow! There are about 10 companies who need rides to and from the Wellesley Hills commuter rail station, and we'll need about 5 or 6 drivers to shuttle them. They are arriving around 11:00 AM. If you have a car, this would be a great opportunity for you to chat one on one with some awesome startups, plus we'll pay you 15 bucks. 

Email foundryboard at lists.olin.edu ASAP if you are interested.

Thanks!
Steph on behalf of the Foundry Board

The 74th season of Masterworks Chorale continues with the Boston area's onl=
y performance this season of the transcendent Saint Matthew Passion of Joha=
nn Sebastian Bach. Steven Karidoyanes conducts the Chorale's double-chorus =
and double-orchestra, a children's chorus, and a fine cast of soloists in t=
his monumental oratorio. The event is preceded by a Pre-Concert Talk by Lau=
ra Prichard.





Saturday, March 22, 2014
Sanders Theatre, Cambridge
      7:00 PM - Pre-Concert Talk
      7:30 PM - Concert
J.S. BACH Saint Matthew Passion

[https://imgssl.constantcontact.com/letters/images/1101116784221/PM_B2CEP_F=
ooterLeftAccent.png]

Our Mission:
Making masterworks meaningful through performances
that excite, engage, and inspire,
and through outreach efforts across all ages.
Founded in 1940, Masterworks Chorale is one of the leading choruses in the =
Boston area and an active part of the region's musical community.  Led by c=
onductor Steven Karidoyanes, Masterworks draws its committed singers, profe=
ssional orchestra and talented soloists from throughout New England. The Ch=
orale performs a three-concert series at Sanders Theatre, Cambridge, offers=
 popular community Sings at the holidays and in the summer, and provides in=
tergenerational outreach opportunities.

[https://imgssl.constantcontact.com/letters/images/1101116784221/PM_B2CEP_F=
ooterRightAccent.png]

pan style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Trebuchet MS","sans-serif";color=
:#DDD68E'>Founded in 1940, Masterworks Chorale is one of the leading chorus=
es in the Boston area and an active part of the region's musical community.=
&nbsp; Led by conductor Steven Karidoyanes, Masterworks draws its committed=
 singers, professional orchestra and talented soloists from throughout New =
England. The Chorale performs a three-concert series at Sanders Theatre, Ca=
mbridge, offers popular community Sings at the holidays and in the summer, =
and provides intergenerational outreach opportunities.</span><span style=3D=

Hey carpe,

I imagine a lot of you had the chance to talk to the great folks from
Quanttus <http://www.quanttus.com>, a personal healthcare company, at the
startup fair yesterday. The Quanttus team will be back on campus tomorrow
to give a tech talk at 6:00 in AC113.

You'll get a chance to hear from:
Chris Loughnane, Senior Mechanical Engineer
Bo Argus, Cheif Architect
Jason Srokis, Head of Data Analytics

And of course, there will be plenty of pizza!
Hope to see many of you there.

Have a good one,
Madison

From Kimly.Do at students.olin.edu  Thu Feb 20 11:32:46 2014
From: Kimly.Do at students.olin.edu (Kimly Do)
Date: Thu, 20 Feb 2014 11:32:46 -0500
Subject: [Carpediem] Reminder!! tonight!!: James Regulinski ('12) Talks
 about Real World Sustainable and Affordable Design
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013597C72F63@EXVS01.olin.edu>

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013597C72F63EXVS01oline_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Tonight at 8!!
EH1 Lounge!!!



From: Kimly Do
Sent: Thursday, February 13, 2014 9:09 AM
To: 'studentevents at lists.olin.edu'; carpediem at lists.olin.edu<mailto:carpedi=
em at lists.olin.edu>
Subject: James Regulinski ('12) Talks about Real World Sustainable and Affo=
rdable Design

Thursday, Feb 20th
8:00pm, EH1 Lounge

Join James Regulinski, '12 as he shares his experiences working for All Pow=
er Labs<http://allpowerlabs.org/>, a company making an affordable biomass g=
enerator that provides sustainable energy all over the world.

We'll have some of James's favorite locally-sourced cheese and environmenta=
lly responsible noms. James is a very thoughtful and values-driven person, =
and he has taken bold steps to situate himself where he can make the most o=
f his experiences. James has a very clear perspective on life that he'd lik=
e to share with current Oliners!

A message from James:
Hi everyone, I graduated Olin in December of 2012 and was looking for a pla=
ce to work that could use the prototyping, mechanical, fabrication, and des=
ign skills I had acquired at Olin, and focused on either sustainable design=
 or engineering for the other 4 billion. That is when I found All Power Lab=
s (APL).

APL makes a integrated gasifier-generator unit, that fits in the foot print=
 of a standard shipping pallet. Much like Mr. Fusion from Back To The Futur=
e, our machine takes waste biomass and turns it into electricity. The techn=
ology is currently being used to provide power to under electrified areas i=
n Liberia, Indonesia, Haiti (along with many other areas) as well as clean =
power to the grid in Italy and the USA.

During this session I will talk about how the core technology works, how af=
fordability and sustainability have drive the product design, and how I am =
using what I learned at Olin to help make this all happen.

-.- -.- -.... -.. ..-. --.
James Marshall
 Myers Regulinski

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013597C72F63EXVS01oline_

le=3D'background:white'><span style=3D'font-size:9.5pt;font-family:"Calibri=
","sans-serif";color:#222222'>Hi everyone, I graduated Olin in December of =
2012 and was looking for a place to work that could use the prototyping, me=
chanical, fabrication, and design skills I had acquired at Olin, and focuse=
d on either&nbsp;sustainable&nbsp;design or engineering for the other 4 bil=
lion. That is when I found All Power Labs (APL).</span><span style=3D'color=
:#8064A2'><o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'background:wh=
ite'><span style=3D'color:#8064A2'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=3DM=
soNormal style=3D'background:white'><span style=3D'font-size:9.5pt;font-fam=
ily:"Calibri","sans-serif";color:#222222'>APL makes a integrated gasifier-g=
enerator unit, that fits in the foot print of a standard shipping pallet. M=
uch like Mr. Fusion from Back To The Future, our machine takes waste biomas=
s and turns it into electricity. The technology is currently being used to =
provide power to under electrified areas in Liberia, Indonesia, Haiti (alon=
g with many other areas) as well as clean power to the grid in Italy and th=
e USA.</span><span style=3D'color:#8064A2'><o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=

n style=3D'font-size:9.5pt;font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";color:#222222=
'>During this session I will talk about how the core technology works, how =
affordability and sustainability have drive the product design, and how I a=
m using what I learned at Olin to help make this all happen.&nbsp;</span><s=

From Emily.Wang at students.olin.edu  Thu Feb 20 12:32:17 2014
From: Emily.Wang at students.olin.edu (Emily Wang)
Date: Thu, 20 Feb 2014 12:32:17 -0500
Subject: [Carpediem] Get GO bike trained if you're not already / Learn about
 bike repair this semester!
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013597C72FBA@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Content-Type: text/plain; charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hi Carpe!

Here are some spring semester updates from the GO bike repair team. Woot!


(1)    All locks have now been updated to the new combination!
                If you're using a GO bike, you must have already completed =
the training (otherwise it's a violation of the honor code). If you got tra=
ined last semester then you're good to go for your entire time at Olin. :)



(2)    If for some reason you didn't get GO bike trained last semester but =
are still interested in using GO bikes someday, please sign up!! --> tinyur=
l.com/gobikes-training-signup


(3)    If you want to learn how to repair bikes and/or joining the GO bike =
team, once the weather clears up we're going to offer a series of fun bike =
repair workshops (includes replacing flat tires, tinkering with bike chains=
, repairing brakes, truing wheels...). These are meant to be fun and low-st=
ress workshops for people of any skill level.
Reply to this message if you're interested (in either teaching or learning)=
 and I'll send you the deets! :D<3

May your wheels always stay true and your blinky lights bright,
<3Emily and Jennifer

From Brian.Liebson at students.olin.edu  Thu Feb 20 13:32:37 2014
From: Brian.Liebson at students.olin.edu (Brian Liebson)
Date: Thu, 20 Feb 2014 13:32:37 -0500
Subject: [Carpediem] Did a Cross Registered student give you her problem set?
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013597C7301A@EXVS01.olin.edu>

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013597C7301AEXVS01oline_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hello Peoples,

I don't mean to spam these lists but I have no idea who this person might b=
e:

One cross registered student in Zhenya's Mechanics class apparently was try=
ing to find me and couldn't so she gave her problem set to someone in West =
Hall to give to me.

Did she give it to you? I need it really badly.


Thanks in advance!
Brian Liebson

FWOP's spring show, "A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to the Forum" opens =
tomorrow night at eight o'clock.  It's a hysterical musical full of decepti=
on and elaborate plots. Trust me, you don't want to miss it.  If you are in=
terested come over to Sorenson Theater by eight o'clock  Friday or Saturday=
 this weekend and the weekend following.  Tickets cost $5. I promise you wo=
n't be disappointed. I look forward to seeing you there!

sterday. The Quanttus team=A0will be back on campus tomorrow to give a tech=
 talk at 6:00 in AC113. =A0</div>





<div><br></div><div>You&#39;ll get a chance to hear from:</div><div><span s=
tyle=3D"font-family:arial,sans-serif;font-size:13px">Chris Loughnane, Senio=
r Mechanical Engineer</span><br></div><div><span style=3D"font-family:arial=
,sans-serif;font-size:13px">Bo Argus, Cheif Architect</span></div>





<div><span style=3D"font-family:arial,sans-serif;font-size:13px">Jason Srok=
is, Head of Data Analytics</span></div><div><span style=3D"font-family:aria=
l,sans-serif;font-size:13px"><br></span></div><div><span style=3D"font-fami=
ly:arial,sans-serif;font-size:13px">And of course, there will be plenty of =
pizza!<br>




Hope to see many of you there.<br><br></span></div><div><span style=3D"font=
-family:arial,sans-serif;font-size:13px">Have a good one,</span></div>
<div><span style=3D"font-family:arial,sans-serif;font-size:13px">Madison</s=
pan><br></div><div><br><br></div></div>

From Lyra.Silverwolf at students.olin.edu  Thu Feb 20 20:07:25 2014
From: Lyra.Silverwolf at students.olin.edu (Lyra Silverwolf)
Date: Thu, 20 Feb 2014 20:07:25 -0500
Subject: [Carpediem] NOW James Regulinski ('12) Talks about Real World
 Sustainable and Affordable Design
In-Reply-To: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013597C72F63@EXVS01.olin.edu>
References: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013597C72F63@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Come to EH1 lounge now to hear awesome stories and things!



On Feb 20, 2014, at 11:32 AM, Kimly Do <Kimly.Do at students.olin.edu<mailto:K=
imly.Do at students.olin.edu>> wrote:

Tonight at 8!!
EH1 Lounge!!!



From: Kimly Do
Sent: Thursday, February 13, 2014 9:09 AM
To: 'studentevents at lists.olin.edu<mailto:studentevents at lists.olin.edu>'; ca=
rpediem at lists.olin.edu<mailto:carpediem at lists.olin.edu>
Subject: James Regulinski ('12) Talks about Real World Sustainable and Affo=
rdable Design

Thursday, Feb 20th
8:00pm, EH1 Lounge

Join James Regulinski, '12 as he shares his experiences working for All Pow=
er Labs<http://allpowerlabs.org/>, a company making an affordable biomass g=
enerator that provides sustainable energy all over the world.

We'll have some of James's favorite locally-sourced cheese and environmenta=
lly responsible noms. James is a very thoughtful and values-driven person, =
and he has taken bold steps to situate himself where he can make the most o=
f his experiences. James has a very clear perspective on life that he'd lik=
e to share with current Oliners!

A message from James:
Hi everyone, I graduated Olin in December of 2012 and was looking for a pla=
ce to work that could use the prototyping, mechanical, fabrication, and des=
ign skills I had acquired at Olin, and focused on either sustainable design=
 or engineering for the other 4 billion. That is when I found All Power Lab=
s (APL).

APL makes a integrated gasifier-generator unit, that fits in the foot print=
 of a standard shipping pallet. Much like Mr. Fusion from Back To The Futur=
e, our machine takes waste biomass and turns it into electricity. The techn=
ology is currently being used to provide power to under electrified areas i=
n Liberia, Indonesia, Haiti (along with many other areas) as well as clean =
power to the grid in Italy and the USA.

During this session I will talk about how the core technology works, how af=
fordability and sustainability have drive the product design, and how I am =
using what I learned at Olin to help make this all happen.

-.- -.- -.... -.. ..-. --.
James Marshall
 Myers Regulinski
_______________________________________________

Carpediem at lists.olin.edu<mailto:Carpediem at lists.olin.edu>
https://lists.olin.edu/mailman/listinfo/carpediem

Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Olin's chapter of Society of Asian Scientists and Engineers (yes, we're a n=
ew thing) is co-hosting a scavenger hunt with the chapters from Northeaster=
n, Boston University, and MIT this Saturday afternoon! You can form your ow=
n team or you can be mixed with students from all the other schools. Teams =
will work together to complete challenges, find items, and earn points. It'=
s a great way to get off campus and meet some new people! :) Details are in=
 the flyer and links provided below.

FYI registration is $5 but there's free Thai food! And prizes!

FB event: https://www.facebook.com/events/584232221660860/?ref_dashboard_fi=
lter=3Dupcoming
Registration: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/10bY4vIshyQsdw8_RtwRlp-q9uIVs=
lgkvvlkq4vXTqNE/viewform

Let me know if you're interested so I can get a head count/coordinate trans=
portation if necessary!

	{mso-style-priority:99;
	mso-style-link:"Balloon Text Char";
	margin:0in;
	margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	font-size:8.0pt;
	font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif";}

	{mso-style-type:personal-compose;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";
	color:windowtext;}
span.BalloonTextChar
	{mso-style-name:"Balloon Text Char";
	mso-style-priority:99;
	mso-style-link:"Balloon Text";
	font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif";}

	{mso-style-type:export-only;}

	{size:8.5in 11.0in;
	margin:1.0in 1.0in 1.0in 1.0in;}
div.WordSection1
	{page:WordSection1;}

pter of Society of Asian Scientists and Engineers (yes, we&#8217;re a new t=
hing) is co-hosting a scavenger hunt with the chapters from Northeastern, B=
oston University, and MIT this Saturday afternoon! You can form your own te=
am or you can be mixed with students from all the other schools. Teams will=

From Kaitlin.Gallagher at students.olin.edu  Fri Feb 21 22:33:37 2014

Subject: [Carpediem] Lost prox + ducktape holder
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40135971E3FA4@EXVS01.olin.edu>

My prox lives in a ducktape holder on a ruberband on a carabiner. The rubber band broke, leaving me with a carabiner, which isn't particularly useful for getting into buildings. If you see a prox-side ducktape pocket, let me know! It's probably somewhere between the AC, the dinning hall, and EH.

Kaitlin

Happening today at 3 pm! The weather outside is beautiful... so it's a grea=
t day to get off campus and meet some new people! Again, let me know if you=
're interested or want more details. :)

From: Irene Hwang
Sent: Thursday, February 20, 2014 10:49 PM
To: carpediem at lists.olin.edu
Subject: Boston Scavenger Hunt

Olin's chapter of Society of Asian Scientists and Engineers (yes, we're a n=
ew thing) is co-hosting a scavenger hunt with the chapters from Northeaster=
n, Boston University, and MIT this Saturday afternoon! You can form your ow=
n team or you can be mixed with students from all the other schools. Teams =
will work together to complete challenges, find items, and earn points. It'=
s a great way to get off campus and meet some new people! :) Details are in=
 the flyer and links provided below.

FYI registration is $5 but there's free Thai food! And prizes!

FB event: https://www.facebook.com/events/584232221660860/?ref_dashboard_fi=
lter=3Dupcoming
Registration: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/10bY4vIshyQsdw8_RtwRlp-q9uIVs=
lgkvvlkq4vXTqNE/viewform

Let me know if you're interested so I can get a head count/coordinate trans=
portation if necessary!

From Katherine.Bender at students.olin.edu  Mon Feb 24 11:45:06 2014
From: Katherine.Bender at students.olin.edu (Katherine Bender)
Date: Mon, 24 Feb 2014 11:45:06 -0500
Subject: [Carpediem] SOAP!
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013597FE9594@EXVS01.olin.edu>

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013597FE9594EXVS01oline_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hello!!!

TLDR: Homemade soap for sale!

NTLDR:
So, as a few of you may know, Chani and I have been making some homemade so=
ap. Though this is spectacular fun, we do not use soap at the rate that we =
make it. (Yes, we do use soap. I promise. Just not that quickly.)

Anyway, we're looking to get rid of some of our excess to make room for new=
 batches. If you'd be interested in buying some at whatever price you'd lik=
e to name, we'd be interested in selling it to you! The most recent batch w=
e've made is rosemary and lavender scented, with or without hibiscus flower=
 tea petals inside. (It smells very nice :) )

The neat thing is that we can name you every ingredient in the soap; it's g=
ot minimalist ingredients. (Chani's gonna hate me for this hippie dippie li=
ngo) You can know exactly what's inside!

Also, if you'd like to just stop by and try it/smell it/have suggestions as=
 to what would make good soap scents/anything else please do! (... that was=
n't a sentence.)

Anway. That's all.
Lemme know!
Thanks,
Bye,
Kari

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013597FE9594EXVS01oline_

From Gregory.Edelston at students.olin.edu  Mon Feb 24 15:20:15 2014
From: Gregory.Edelston at students.olin.edu (Gregory Edelston)
Date: Mon, 24 Feb 2014 15:20:15 -0500
Subject: [Carpediem] =?iso-8859-1?q?Olin_Plays_Twitch_Plays_Pok=E9mon?=
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013597FE96E9@EXVS01.olin.edu>

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013597FE96E9EXVS01oline_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

FriendlyFire and Pok=E9mon Club present...
OLIN PLAYS TWITCH PLAYS POKEMON

WHO: As many Oliners as we can get.
WHAT: One game of Pok=E9mon Gold. Everyone can send commands. Every command=
 is interpreted.
WHEN: Tonight. 10PM-midnight.
WHERE: www.twitch.tv/gredelston<http://www.twitch.tv/gredelston>. But more =
importantly, on a projector in the auditorium! It'll be way more fun to all=
 be in the same room yelling at each other.
WHY: [tbd]

Be there and watch the mess unfold.
-Greg, on behalf of FF and Pok=E9mon Club


NITTY-GRITTY FAQ:
Q: Are you serious?
A: I am not the sort of man to joke around.

Q: Why only two hours?
A: There aren't enough Oliners to make it interesting as a long-standing ga=
me - if we just left it up, it would turn into one person playing the slowe=
st game of Pok=E9mon ever.

Q: Democracy or Anarchy?
A: Anarchy is the only way.

Q: Why Gold?
A: Because 1st gen has already been done (is being done), and more people w=
ill feel alienated with each successive generation. And Ho-Oh could school =
Lugia any day.
Q: There are only 151 Pok=E9mon!
A: Not a question; also, buzz off.

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013597FE96E9EXVS01oline_

Here, have an iCal.

From: friendlyfire-announce-bounces at lists.olin.edu [mailto:friendlyfire-ann=
ounce-bounces at lists.olin.edu] On Behalf Of Gregory Edelston
Sent: Monday, February 24, 2014 3:20 PM
To: friendlyfire-announce at lists.olin.edu; pokemon at lists.olin.edu
Cc: carpediem at lists.olin.edu
Subject: [FriendlyFire-announce] Olin Plays Twitch Plays Pok=E9mon

FriendlyFire and Pok=E9mon Club present...
OLIN PLAYS TWITCH PLAYS POKEMON

WHO: As many Oliners as we can get.
WHAT: One game of Pok=E9mon Gold. Everyone can send commands. Every command=
 is interpreted.
WHEN: Tonight. 10PM-midnight.
WHERE: www.twitch.tv/gredelston<http://www.twitch.tv/gredelston>. But more =
importantly, on a projector in the auditorium! It'll be way more fun to all=
 be in the same room yelling at each other.
WHY: [tbd]

Be there and watch the mess unfold.
-Greg, on behalf of FF and Pok=E9mon Club


NITTY-GRITTY FAQ:
Q: Are you serious?
A: I am not the sort of man to joke around.

Q: Why only two hours?
A: There aren't enough Oliners to make it interesting as a long-standing ga=
me - if we just left it up, it would turn into one person playing the slowe=
st game of Pok=E9mon ever.

Q: Democracy or Anarchy?
A: Anarchy is the only way.

Q: Why Gold?
A: Because 1st gen has already been done (is being done), and more people w=
ill feel alienated with each successive generation. And Ho-Oh could school =
Lugia any day.

Q: There are only 151 Pok=E9mon!
A: Not a question; also, buzz off.

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013597FE96F8EXVS01oline_

Hey Carpe!

                This year FWOP is trying something new and reaching out to =
non-FWOP members for recommendations for next year's shows! If you're a fan=
 of theater and would like to have a say in what show FWOP puts on simply g=
o to this survey and enter titles of shows you'd be interested in seeing us=
 put on next year.

                https://www.surveymonkey.com/s/KZ28KTC

                Thanks so much!
                -FWOP

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013597FE97D4EXVS01oline_

Happening right meowth in the auditorium and on the internet! www.twitch.tv=
/gredelston

-------- Original message --------
From: Gregory Edelston
Date:02/24/2014 3:20 PM (GMT-05:00)
To: friendlyfire-announce at lists.olin.edu,pokemon at lists.olin.edu
Cc: carpediem at lists.olin.edu
Subject: [FriendlyFire-announce] Olin Plays Twitch Plays Pok=E9mon

FriendlyFire and Pok=E9mon Club present=85
OLIN PLAYS TWITCH PLAYS POKEMON

WHO: As many Oliners as we can get.
WHAT: One game of Pok=E9mon Gold. Everyone can send commands. Every command=
 is interpreted.
WHEN: Tonight. 10PM-midnight.
WHERE: www.twitch.tv/gredelston<http://www.twitch.tv/gredelston>. But more =
importantly, on a projector in the auditorium! It=92ll be way more fun to a=
ll be in the same room yelling at each other.
WHY: [tbd]

Be there and watch the mess unfold.
-Greg, on behalf of FF and Pok=E9mon Club


NITTY-GRITTY FAQ:
Q: Are you serious?
A: I am not the sort of man to joke around.

Q: Why only two hours?
A: There aren=92t enough Oliners to make it interesting as a long-standing =
game =96 if we just left it up, it would turn into one person playing the s=
lowest game of Pok=E9mon ever.

Q: Democracy or Anarchy?
A: Anarchy is the only way.

Q: Why Gold?
A: Because 1st gen has already been done (is being done), and more people w=
ill feel alienated with each successive generation. And Ho-Oh could school =
Lugia any day.
Q: There are only 151 Pok=E9mon!
A: Not a question; also, buzz off.

Subject: [FriendlyFire-announce] Olin Plays Twitch Plays Pok=E9mon

FriendlyFire and Pok=E9mon Club present=85
OLIN PLAYS TWITCH PLAYS POKEMON

WHO: As many Oliners as we can get.
WHAT: One game of Pok=E9mon Gold. Everyone can send commands. Every command=
 is interpreted.
WHEN: Tonight. 10PM-midnight.
WHERE: www.twitch.tv/gredelston<http://www.twitch.tv/gredelston>. But more =
importantly, on a projector in the auditorium! It=92ll be way more fun to a=
ll be in the same room yelling at each other.
WHY: [tbd]

Be there and watch the mess unfold.
-Greg, on behalf of FF and Pok=E9mon Club


NITTY-GRITTY FAQ:
Q: Are you serious?
A: I am not the sort of man to joke around.

Q: Why only two hours?
A: There aren=92t enough Oliners to make it interesting as a long-standing =
game =96 if we just left it up, it would turn into one person playing the s=
lowest game of Pok=E9mon ever.

Q: Democracy or Anarchy?
A: Anarchy is the only way.

Q: Why Gold?
A: Because 1st gen has already been done (is being done), and more people w=
ill feel alienated with each successive generation. And Ho-Oh could school =
Lugia any day.
Q: There are only 151 Pok=E9mon!
A: Not a question; also, buzz off.

F.I.L.M. Club Presents: Short Term 12<http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3DqhS6=
tvSb0UQ\>
10:00 pm Today, Auditorium

[cid:image002.jpg at 01CF322D.43B9A230]

I've been meaning to show this film for a while. Short Term 12 is a film ab=
out a supervisor at a foster-care facility for at-risk teenagers. Brie Lars=
on stars whom you may remember as Envy Adams in Scott Pilgrim.

John Arakaki, F.I.L.M. Director
Amanda Lee, 97 Minute Run Time
Travis Lewis, Potstickers



--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013597FE9C4AEXVS01oline_

>  FriendlyFire and Pok=E9mon Club present...
>
> *OLIN **PLAYS **TWITCH **PLAYS **POKEMON*
>
>
>
> *WHO:* As many Oliners as we can get.
>
> *WHAT:* One game of Pok=E9mon Gold. Everyone can send commands. Every
> command is interpreted.
>
> *WHEN:* Tonight. 10PM-midnight.
>
> *WHERE:* www.twitch.tv/gredelston. But more importantly, on a projector
> in the auditorium! It'll be way more fun to all be in the same room yelli=
ng
> at each other.
>
> *WHY:* [tbd]
>
>
>
> Be there and watch the mess unfold.
>
> -Greg, on behalf of FF and Pok=E9mon Club
>
>
>
>
>
> *NITTY-GRITTY FAQ:*
>
> Q: Are you serious?
>
> A: I am not the sort of man to joke around.
>
>
>
> Q: Why only two hours?
>
> A: There aren't enough Oliners to make it interesting as a long-standing
> game - if we just left it up, it would turn into one person playing the
> slowest game of Pok=E9mon ever.
>
>
>
> Q: Democracy or Anarchy?
>
> A: Anarchy is the only way.
>
>
>
> Q: Why Gold?
>
> A: Because 1st gen has already been done (is being done), and more people
> will feel alienated with each successive generation. And Ho-Oh could scho=
ol
> Lugia any day.
>
>  Q: There are only 151 Pok=E9mon!
>
> A: Not a question; also, buzz off.
>

Hey there y'all! Babson Outdoor Association is doing a ski trip this weeken=
d! From their Facebook:
"Ski with us this weekend at Jay Peak! $150 gets you lift tickets, lodging,=
 food, and transportation (rentals not included). When you're done skiing, =
hang out at Jay's massive indoor water park! This is the perfect weekend ge=
taway for if you are overwhelmed by midterm exams. Signup here: http://bit.=
ly/1fdTob2"
"This trip is now open to Welleslians, Oliners, and Babson Grad Students!"

You should do it!

</blockquote></div><br></div>

--089e0149c38067559c04f35a05ca--

From William.Saulnier at students.olin.edu  Wed Feb 26 23:19:49 2014
From: William.Saulnier at students.olin.edu (William Saulnier)
Date: Wed, 26 Feb 2014 23:19:49 -0500
Subject: [Carpediem] Koding: Online IDE w/ Full Root Linux Control
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE4013596C9FA95@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Discovered this awesome service called Koding. The concept is pretty cool, give everyone a linux VPS to hack on top of, and wrap it around an online collaborative IDE. No pushing code to servers, just work directly on the environment! And the best part? It's free!

They're running a promotion right now where you get an extra gig on top of the three free if you sign up through a referal link... like the one below!

https://koding.com/R/lego6245

Check them out through my link if you want to get a free gig, otherwise you can just google Koding and they're the top result.

Hope this helps in your hacking!

-William


From Franz.Schneider at students.olin.edu  Thu Feb 27 10:12:21 2014
From: Franz.Schneider at students.olin.edu (Franz Schneider)
Date: Thu, 27 Feb 2014 10:12:21 -0500
Subject: [Carpediem] Make a secure tablet app (Paid)
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401359824A20F@EXVS01.olin.edu>

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401359824A20FEXVS01oline_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hi Carpe,

A friend is currently paying a lot of money for a data collection service f=
or research. She's wondering if someone could make a similar app. The servi=
ce they're paying for is quite expensive, so the compensation probably woul=
d be good. The thing is, they're taking patient medical data and the data c=
ollection needs to be provably very secure.

Description: "For this study we are hoping to collect the data on a tablet =
type device.  The device will need to be encrypted.  The participants would=
 be entering the data 2x per day, morning and before bed.  This data would =
be questions about sleep and a question about medication.  The format would=
 be yes/no, rating scales, or time data the participant would enter."

It sounds to me like a couple slider values, a couple text values, and some=
 checkboxes, all wrapped in something that encrypts the data and emails the=
 researchers if the person doesn't fill it out.

Contact me for details,
Eric

From wcdolphin at gmail.com  Thu Feb 27 21:24:55 2014
From: wcdolphin at gmail.com (Cory Dolphin)
Date: Thu, 27 Feb 2014 21:24:55 -0500
Subject: [Carpediem] Product Design and Web Engineering opportunity
Message-ID: <CAOwq=Ts80ADeyMAVvW97CWSQv-BOGbgzuSWzpzDX422+CBaUjg@mail.gmail.com>

--20cf3040e42ebc36a404f36e2401
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1

A solid Babson MBA graduate with real world experience is looking to work
with an Olin student to develop and design an interesting new product.

He is a great guy, and I suggest anyone interested to sit down and grab
coffee with him to talk about the idea, offer advice and consider working
with him (CC'd).

*Problem*: The amount of information/content/data that the average person
> is exposed to daily has been growing exponentially since 1999.  Hundreds of
> tools have been designed to capture this data and with the advances in
> technology our ability to store information has continually improved for
> the end user as well.  The problem with this model is that just because
> technology is advancing, it doesn't me human brain power is.  People need a
> tool that allows them to take full advantage of of the information they are
> exposed to everyday.
> *What:* BrainCrumbs is a web based software that allows the user to
> capture information and easily recall it at a later date.
> *Value Proposition*: BrainCrumbs allows you to never forget what you've
> already learned by helping you recall relevant ideas, thoughts and
> materials when working in real time.  With the ability to commit everything
> to useful memory, you're able to dig deeper, ideate further, brainstorm
> broader, and draw conclusions from a lifetime of context.
> *Need*: I'm looking for technical engineers to help make this idea a
> reality.  To this point I have received positive feedback on BrainCrumbs
> and the value it adds.  I now want to put together an MVP to begin putting
> in front of users to engage with, to identify a true target market for the
> direction of this company.
> I'm looking for anyone who might have an interest in being a part of
> BrainCrumbs, be that part time or full time.  I'm looking for more than
> labor, I want input on everything from design, to functionality, to use.  I
> want to hear your opinions and I'm willing to pay for help but would prefer
> to offer equity to truly involve you in the entire process.


Let me know if you are interested, or contact Tom directly.
Cory

--20cf3040e42ebc36a404f36e2401
Content-Type: text/html; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

seful memory, you&#39;re able to dig deeper, ideate further, brainstorm bro=
ader, and draw conclusions from a lifetime of context.<br>
<b>Need</b>: I&#39;m looking for technical engineers to help make this idea=
 a reality. =A0To this point I have received positive feedback on BrainCrum=
bs and the value it adds. =A0I now want to put together an MVP to begin put=
ting in front of users to engage with, to identify a true target market for=
 the direction of this company.=A0<br>

I&#39;m looking for anyone who might have an interest in being a part of Br=
ainCrumbs, be that part time or full time. =A0I&#39;m looking for more than=

=A0I want to hear your opinions and I&#39;m willing to pay for help but wou=
ld prefer to offer equity to truly involve you in the entire process.=A0</b=
lockquote>
<div><br></div><div>Let me know if you are interested, or contact Tom direc=
tly.=A0</div><div>Cory=A0</div>



</div>

From Dakota.Nelson at students.olin.edu  Fri Feb 28 00:18:28 2014
From: Dakota.Nelson at students.olin.edu (Dakota Nelson)
Date: Fri, 28 Feb 2014 00:18:28 -0500
Subject: [Carpediem] Hack the Planets
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401359824A6EC@EXVS01.olin.edu>

--_004_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401359824A6ECEXVS01oline_
Content-Type: multipart/alternative;
	boundary="_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401359824A6ECEXVS01oline_"

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401359824A6ECEXVS01oline_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hi Carpe!

You know what's awesome? Space.

Every year, NASA (that's right, NASA) sponsors a global (83 cities from 44 =
countries hosted last year) hackathon called the space apps challenge<http:=
//spaceappschallenge.org/about/>. This year, several Babson students are ho=
sting a local event right here in Boston, at the Cambridge Innovation Cente=
r on April 12 and 13. This year's challenges fall into 5 areas: human space=
flight, technology in space, robotics, asteroids, and Earth watch.

The students hosting the event are looking for around 5 Oliners to join the=
ir team, which will be remotely collaborating with a team in Tokyo. The Tok=
yo team is supported by the Japanese consulate, and will have Japanese medi=
a coverage, so they're kind of a big deal.

Alternately, you could just organize your own team and go. Either way, The =
Foundry may be able to provide or assist with transportation, depending on =
interest.

If you're interested in either of these options, let me know, and I'll fill=
 you in on more details as they come out.


Dakota, on behalf of The Foundry


Dakota Nelson | Class of 2017
Tel: 605-877-4076 | URL: www.olin.edu<http://www.olin.edu/>
[cid:image001.png at 01CF3414.2FE04190]



--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401359824A6ECEXVS01oline_

From Jessica.Diller at students.olin.edu  Fri Feb 28 12:01:50 2014
From: Jessica.Diller at students.olin.edu (Jessica Diller)
Date: Fri, 28 Feb 2014 12:01:50 -0500
Subject: [Carpediem] Babson All Things Tech Club
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401359824A83A@EXVS01.olin.edu>

--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401359824A83AEXVS01oline_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Was told to send this to "all the coders I know" by a Babson student I had =
a class with last semester. I think VC means Venture Capitalist.



Hello,

The All Things Tech Club brings tech geniuses, venture capitalists, emergin=
g industries, and software developers together. The goal of the Tech Club i=
s to create a network that connects to startup ecosystems around the world:=
 San Francisco, Boston, Tel Aviv, London, etc. We are focused on sharing id=
eas and solutions amongst talented students and individuals around the worl=
d.

As a club, we host startup weekends with various schools in Boston with VCs=
 in attendance. We host speaker events with entrepreneurs, consulting firms=
, and other cool tech startup founders.

Joining the club is easy, just email gbonilla1 at babson.edu<mailto:gbonilla1@=
babson.edu> to express your interest or if you have any questions.

All the best,

Gerry


--_000_DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401359824A83AEXVS01oline_
